analyzed: brtan pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' // de phyir sangs rgyas mi zad pa //
translated: By stability, there is connate joy.🔽Therefore, the yogi definitely obtains

original: rnal 'byor pa yis nges par 'thob //🔽'di ltar skad cig gis sgom na'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis nges par 'thob // 'di ltar skad cig gis sgom na'o //
translated: the inexhaustibility of the buddhas.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is like this: if one meditates in an instant.

original: gnas ni nor bu'o //
analyzed: gnas ni nor bu'o //
translated: The place is the jewel.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: The change is worldly.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas nyid na yang /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i gnas nyid na yang /
translated: Even in the place of the connate,

original: 'jig rten pa min ni @208b bde ba mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa min ni @208b bde ba mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not worldly, because it is unchanging bliss.

original: yid ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: yid ni khu ba'o //
translated: The mind is semen.

original: mi mthun pas ni lugs las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pas ni lugs las bzlog pas so //
translated: By the reverse order, it is not compatible.

original: brtan ni spyi bor ro //
analyzed: brtan ni spyi bor ro //
translated: It is firm at the top.

original: goms pa'i stobs su ni mchog tu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs su ni mchog tu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of practice is supreme, etc.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo kho na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyi dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i ngo bo kho na stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyi dpal ldan rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs te /
translated: The nature of innate joy itself is the form of glorious Vajrasattva, which is the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion.

original: des 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba dag byed cing /
analyzed: des 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i bya ba dag byed cing /
translated: By that, one performs the actions of going and coming.

original: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rol to /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rol to /
translated: The bodhicitta is the play of the vajra.

original: ji ltar bde bar ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar ni /
translated: As one wishes,

original: chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it becomes the different divisions of the small, and so on.

original: 'dir ni ste lus la dang rtsa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni ste lus la dang rtsa rnams la'o //
translated: Here, in the body and in the channels,

original: de ni mngal gyi gnas skabs su dang por snying gi rtsa lnga rnams skyes pa gsum rnams so zhes pa brgyad rnams so //
analyzed: de ni mngal gyi gnas skabs su dang por snying gi rtsa lnga rnams skyes pa gsum rnams so zhes pa brgyad rnams so //
translated: in the womb, first, the five channels of the heart are produced.

original: de la 'dab ma rnams kyi bzhi yis 'byung ba'i rtsa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la 'dab ma rnams kyi bzhi yis 'byung ba'i rtsa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Of these, the four petals are the channels of the elements.

original: phyogs rnams su bzhi rnams ni 'byung ba bzhi rnams dang de'i rang bzhin rnams 'bab po zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: phyogs rnams su bzhi rnams ni 'byung ba bzhi rnams dang de'i rang bzhin rnams 'bab po zhes byas nas so //
translated: The four in the directions are the four elements and their natures.

original: mtshams su bzhi rnams ni so sor bshang ba dang gci ba dang bad kan dang khrag dang khu ba rnams 'bab pa 'byung ba'i rtsa rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa /
analyzed: mtshams su bzhi rnams ni so sor bshang ba dang gci ba dang bad kan dang khrag dang khu ba rnams 'bab pa 'byung ba'i rtsa rnams kyi lhan cig byed pa /
translated: The four in the intermediate directions are the channels of the elements that flow separately as feces, urine, phlegm, blood, and semen.🔽The four in the corners are the channels of form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams 'bab pa'i phyir mchod pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams 'bab pa'i phyir mchod pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Their nature is worship, because they flow as form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: de'i rang bzhin yang dngos por na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin yang dngos por na 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Their nature is also the elements and the derivatives of the elements, because there is no difference between them in reality.

original: 'di ltar aa wa dh'u t'i'i dang lhan cig rtsa lnga rnams dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar aa wa dh'u t'i'i dang lhan cig rtsa lnga rnams dang po ste /
translated: Thus, the five channels together with the avadhūtī are the first.

original: de'i rjes su gsum dang de nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gsum dang de nas nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes pa'o //
translated: After that, there are three, and then twenty-four.

original: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis mgo bor skyes pa rnams ra bu byed pa gnyis par mdor bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis mgo bor skyes pa rnams ra bu byed pa gnyis par mdor bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The thirty-two channels that arise in the head are the fence.

original: de rnams kyi gsum ni rdul dang snying stobs dang mun pa'i ngo bo ra sa n'a dang la la n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i rnams gtso mo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsum ni rdul dang snying stobs dang mun pa'i ngo bo ra sa n'a dang la la n'a dang aa wa dh'u t'i rnams gtso mo ste /
translated: These are the three principal ones: the rasanā, lalanā, and avadhūtī, which have the natures of passion, courage, and darkness.

original: khyad par gyi las kyis lhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par gyi las kyis lhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are principal because they are superior due to their special functions.

original: de ltar ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor skyes pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis thun mong gi las ni byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni bde ba chen po'i 'khor lor skyes pa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis thun mong gi las ni byang chub kyi sems 'bab pa'o //
translated: Thus, the thirty-two channels that arise in the great-bliss chakra have the common function of the descent of bodhicitta.

original: khyad par gyi las ni so so ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi las ni so so ste /
translated: They have special functions individually.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: pu llir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pu llir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the groin, and so on.

original: rgyus pa gnas zhes pa rgyus pa 'bab pa dang zhag 'bab pa ste thung ngu ma'o //
analyzed: rgyus pa gnas zhes pa rgyus pa 'bab pa dang zhag 'bab pa ste thung ngu ma'o //
translated: The “joint location” is the descent of sinew and the descent of fat.

original: rus sbal skyes ma ni rus pa 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: rus sbal skyes ma ni rus pa 'bab pa'o //
translated: The “turtle-born” is the descent of bone.

original: @209a * // snying gnas ni snying 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: @209a * // snying gnas ni snying 'bab pa'o //
translated: The “heart location” is the descent of the heart.

original: glo ba bcas zhes pa glo ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: glo ba bcas zhes pa glo ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: The “with lungs” is the descent of the lungs.

original: rgyu ma 'bab pa ni mtshan mo ma'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma 'bab pa ni mtshan mo ma'o //
translated: The cause of the downward flow is the night.

original: lto ba gnas zhes pa lto ba 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: lto ba gnas zhes pa lto ba 'bab pa'o //
translated: The abode of the belly is the flow of the belly.

original: skra mtshams 'bab pa ni dga' ba'i gdong ma'o //
analyzed: skra mtshams 'bab pa ni dga' ba'i gdong ma'o //
translated: The flow of the hairline is the face of joy.

original: gzugs bzang ma'i rtsa ni bad kan dang reg bya 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang ma'i rtsa ni bad kan dang reg bya 'bab pa'o //
translated: The channel of the beautiful form is the flow of phlegm and touch.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i gzhung 'grel du bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i gzhung 'grel du bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is explained in the commentary on the fearless:

original: reg la rnal 'byor ma zhes pa ni gzugs can ma'o //
analyzed: reg la rnal 'byor ma zhes pa ni gzugs can ma'o //
translated: The yoginī of touch is Rūpiṇī.

original: de lta kho nar rgyud gzhan du gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta kho nar rgyud gzhan du gsungs so //
translated: It is taught in another tantra in just this way.

original: dmar po zhes pa khrag 'bab cing bad dkan yang ste rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmar po zhes pa khrag 'bab cing bad dkan yang ste rgyud gzhan du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The red one is the flow of blood and phlegm, because it is taught in another tantra.

original: sdu gu ma ni tshil dang smyon chu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: sdu gu ma ni tshil dang smyon chu 'bab pa'o //
translated: The lovely one is the flow of fat and urine.

original: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don te /🔽mgo po ma la yar mi phyed ma ni sen mo dang so rnams 'bebs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don te / mgo po ma la yar mi phyed ma ni sen mo dang so rnams 'bebs so //
translated: This is the summarized meaning here.🔽The head channel is the flow of nails and teeth.

original: spyi gtsug dz'a landha ra ru phra mos skra dang ba spu rnams so //
analyzed: spyi gtsug dz'a landha ra ru phra mos skra dang ba spu rnams so //
translated: The crown channel is the flow of hair and body hair in Jālandhara.

original: rna ba g-yas pa ao di y'a na ru rtsen mas lpags pa dang dri ma rnams so //
analyzed: rna ba g-yas pa ao di y'a na ru rtsen mas lpags pa dang dri ma rnams so //
translated: The right ear is Oḍiyāna, where the goddess Sporting Woman is the skin and the impurities.

original: rgyab stod aa rbu da ru g-yon pa ma sha'o //
analyzed: rgyab stod aa rbu da ru g-yon pa ma sha'o //
translated: The upper back is Arbuda, where the goddess Left-Hand Woman is the flesh.

original: rna ba g-yon pa go d'a ba r'i ru thung du ma ni zhag dang rgyus pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba g-yon pa go d'a ba r'i ru thung du ma ni zhag dang rgyus pa'o //
translated: The left ear is Godāvarī, where the goddess Short Woman is the blood and the sinews.

original: smin ma gnyis kyi dbus r'a me shva ra rus sbal skyes ma ni rus pa rnams so //
analyzed: smin ma gnyis kyi dbus r'a me shva ra rus sbal skyes ma ni rus pa rnams so //
translated: The middle of the two eyebrows is Rāmeśvara, where the goddess Tortoise Woman is the bones.

original: mig gnyis de w'i ko ta ru sgom pa mo ni mkhal ma'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis de w'i ko ta ru sgom pa mo ni mkhal ma'o //
translated: The two eyes are Devīkoṭa, where the goddess Meditative Woman is the kidneys.

original: dpung pa gnyis kyi rtsa ba m'a la ba ru dbang bskur ma ni snying ste bad kan yang ngo //
analyzed: dpung pa gnyis kyi rtsa ba m'a la ba ru dbang bskur ma ni snying ste bad kan yang ngo //
translated: The roots of the two shoulders are Mālava, where the goddess Consecrated Woman is the heart and the phlegm.

original: mchan khung gnyis k'a ma r'u par skyon ma ni mig dag go //
analyzed: mchan khung gnyis k'a ma r'u par skyon ma ni mig dag go //
translated: The two armpits are Kāmarūpa, where the goddess Faulty Woman is the eyes.

original: nu ma gnyis ao tre ru 'jug ma mkhris pa'o //
analyzed: nu ma gnyis ao tre ru 'jug ma mkhris pa'o //
translated: The two breasts are Oḍra, where the goddess Pervasive Woman is the bile.

original: lte ba tri sha ku ni ru ma ma ma ni glo ba'o //
analyzed: lte ba tri sha ku ni ru ma ma ma ni glo ba'o //
translated: The navel is Triśakuni, where the goddess Mother Woman is the lungs.

original: sna ko sha la ru mtshan mo ma ni rgyu ma'o //
analyzed: sna ko sha la ru mtshan mo ma ni rgyu ma'o //
translated: The nose is Kośala, where the goddess Night Woman is the intestines.

original: kha ka ling+ga ru bsil ster ma ni rtsib logs kyi rgyud rnams so //
analyzed: kha ka ling+ga ru bsil ster ma ni rtsib logs kyi rgyud rnams so //
translated: The mouth is Kaliṅga, where the goddess Cool Woman is the ribs.

original: mgrin pa lamba ka ru drod ma ni lto ba'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa lamba ka ru drod ma ni lto ba'o //
translated: At the throat, in Lampaka, is Dhumavati, the heat.

original: snying ga k'a nytsi ru rab 'bar ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga k'a nytsi ru rab 'bar ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: At the heart, in Kanya, is Suci, the fire.

original: pho mtshan hi ma la ya ru dga' gdong ma ni skra mtshams so //🔽rtags yi dags kyi gnas su gzugs can ma reg bya dang bad kan no //
analyzed: pho mtshan hi ma la ya ru dga' gdong ma ni skra mtshams so // rtags yi dags kyi gnas su gzugs can ma reg bya dang bad kan no //
translated: At the genitals, in Himavat, is Raktasarasvati, the hair.

original: bshang lam gri ha de wa ru spyi ma rnag go //🔽brla gnyis soo r'a shta ru rgyu sbyin ma khrag dang bad kan dag go //
analyzed: bshang lam gri ha de wa ru spyi ma rnag go // brla gnyis soo r'a shta ru rgyu sbyin ma khrag dang bad kan dag go //
translated: At the anus, in Grihadevata, is Rupini, the tactile objects and phlegm.🔽At the thighs, in Sosadvipa, is Pukkasi, the blood and phlegm.

original: byin pa gnyis gser gling du sbyor bral ma rdul lo //
analyzed: byin pa gnyis gser gling du sbyor bral ma rdul lo //
translated: At the calves, in Godaniya, is Savarni, the feces.🔽At the knees, in Simhala, is Varahi, the wind.

original: sor mo bcu drug n'a ga ra ru sdug gu ma myos byed dang tshil bu'o //
analyzed: sor mo bcu drug n'a ga ra ru sdug gu ma myos byed dang tshil bu'o //
translated: At the ankles, in Kamboja, is Chaurasya, the urine.🔽At the toes, in Nagara, is Manmatha, the semen.

original: rkang pa'i bol gnyis sindh'u ru grub pa ma mya ngan dang mchi ma dag go //
analyzed: rkang pa'i bol gnyis sindh'u ru grub pa ma mya ngan dang mchi ma dag go //
translated: At the soles of the feet, in Sindhu, is Siddha, the tears.

original: mthe @209b bong bzhi ma ru ru mtshed ma mchil ma'o //
analyzed: mthe @209b bong bzhi ma ru ru mtshed ma mchil ma'o //
translated: At the heels, in Maru, is Mati, the saliva.

original: pus mo gnyis ku la ta ru yid bzang ma snabs dang kha chu'o //
analyzed: pus mo gnyis ku la ta ru yid bzang ma snabs dang kha chu'o //
translated: At the knees, in Kuluta, is Subhadra, the mucus and nasal discharge.

original: sum bskor ma ni gzugs so //
analyzed: sum bskor ma ni gzugs so //
translated: The navel is form.

original: 'dod pa ma ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ma ni sgra'o //
translated: The genitals are sound.

original: khyim ma ni dri'o //
analyzed: khyim ma ni dri'o //
translated: The house is smell.

original: gtum mo ni ro'o //
analyzed: gtum mo ni ro'o //
translated: The fierce one is taste.

original: bdud 'dral ma ni chos so //
analyzed: bdud 'dral ma ni chos so //
translated: The demoness is dharma.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i ni byang chub kyi sems mun pa'i ngo bo 'bebs so //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i ni byang chub kyi sems mun pa'i ngo bo 'bebs so //
translated: The avadhūtī is the bodhicitta that descends in the form of darkness.

original: la la n'a lte ba'i rtsa bar 'phyang ba ni snying stobs 'bebs shing /
analyzed: la la n'a lte ba'i rtsa bar 'phyang ba ni snying stobs 'bebs shing /
translated: The lalanā, hanging down at the navel, is the descent of sattva.

original: zos pa dang 'thungs pa pho ba'i mes zhu ba rnams las ro yang ste de las ro bcud rtsa gzhan dang gzhan du 'phos pas lus khyad par byed do //
analyzed: zos pa dang 'thungs pa pho ba'i mes zhu ba rnams las ro yang ste de las ro bcud rtsa gzhan dang gzhan du 'phos pas lus khyad par byed do //
translated: The rasa, which is the essence of what is eaten and drunk, is digested by the fire of the stomach. From that, the rasa moves to other channels, and the body is transformed.

original: ra sa n'a ro las khrag 'bebs te /
analyzed: ra sa n'a ro las khrag 'bebs te /
translated: The rasanā is the descent of blood.

original: de las de yang de lta kho nar lus khyab par byed do //🔽rtsa 'di gnyis la nye bar brten pa'i ro dang khrag la brten pas gzhan rnams kyi las gsungs so //
analyzed: de las de yang de lta kho nar lus khyab par byed do // rtsa 'di gnyis la nye bar brten pa'i ro dang khrag la brten pas gzhan rnams kyi las gsungs so //
translated: From that, it spreads throughout the body in the same way.🔽The functions of the other channels are said to be based on the rasa and blood that are in close proximity to these two channels.

original: rgyud 'di las ma gsungs pa'i rtsa rnams kyi las ni rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas brjod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud 'di las ma gsungs pa'i rtsa rnams kyi las ni rgyud gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bas brjod par shes par bya'o //
translated: The functions of the channels not mentioned in this tantra should be understood by following other tantras.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i ming gzhan ni aa wa dh'u t'i kho na dung can ma ste khu ba dang khrag 'bab pa'i phyir ro //🔽rdul 'bab phyir na gtum mo ste /
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i ming gzhan ni aa wa dh'u t'i kho na dung can ma ste khu ba dang khrag 'bab pa'i phyir ro // rdul 'bab phyir na gtum mo ste /
translated: The other name of the avadhūtī is avadhūtī, because it is the conch-shell, since it is the flow of semen and blood.

original: khu ba 'bab phyir mkha' 'gro sdong //🔽steng du bud med zla mtshan la //
analyzed: khu ba 'bab phyir mkha' 'gro sdong // steng du bud med zla mtshan la //
translated: It is caṇḍālī because of the flow of semen, and dakini because of the flow of blood.🔽The flow of blood is above, and the flow of semen is below.

original: g-yung mo skyes pa'i kun 'dar ma //
analyzed: g-yung mo skyes pa'i kun 'dar ma //
translated: The flow of semen is the male nerve, and the flow of blood is the female nerve.🔽Thus, it is said that the eight places such as Malaya are the wheel of mind, the eight such as Kāmarūpa are the wheel of speech, and the eight such as Preta are the wheel of body.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i 'dod pa sna tshogs pa nyid las so //🔽'dir ma la ya la sogs pa'i gnas brgyad rnams ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gdul bya'i 'dod pa sna tshogs pa nyid las so // 'dir ma la ya la sogs pa'i gnas brgyad rnams ni thugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: This is because of the various desires of those to be trained.

original: k'a ma ru pa la sogs pa brgyad rnams gsung gi 'khor lo'o //🔽yi dags gnas pa la sogs pa brgyad rnams sku'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: k'a ma ru pa la sogs pa brgyad rnams gsung gi 'khor lo'o //🔽yi dags gnas pa la sogs pa brgyad rnams sku'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: Here, the eight places such as Malaya are the wheel of mind, the eight such as Kāmarūpa are the wheel of speech, and the eight such as Preta are the wheel of body.

original: 'khor lo 'di rnams su gang rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang / gang yang rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor du rab gtum mo la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang kye'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dang bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor du goo r'i la sogs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'khor lo 'di rnams su gang rdo rje sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor du rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams dang / gang yang rig pa'i rgyal po'i dkyil 'khor du rab gtum mo la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang kye'i rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor dang bdag med ma'i dkyil 'khor du goo r'i la sogs pa rnams dang /
translated: In these wheels, Vajra Caṇḍī and so on are goddesses in the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva, and also in the maṇḍala of the king of awareness, Caṇḍaroṣaṇā and so on, and also in the maṇḍala of Hevajra and the maṇḍala of Nairātmya, Gaurī and so on.

original: gang yang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge ma la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom par sdom pa mo dang k'i li k'i la la sogs pa rnams dang /🔽gang yang rdo rje @210a * //
analyzed: gang yang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i dkyil 'khor du seng ge ma la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par sbyor ba mkha' 'gro ma dra ba sdom par sdom pa mo dang k'i li k'i la la sogs pa rnams dang / gang yang rdo rje @210a * //
translated: Also, in the maṇḍala of the dakini of Timeless Awareness, Siṃghalī and so on, and also in the Web of Magical Display of the dakinis of the union of all buddhas, Saṃvarī and Kaliṅga and so on.

original: bdud rtsir zla ba'i ri mo ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: bdud rtsir zla ba'i ri mo ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Also, in Vajra Amṛta, Candrarekhā and so on.

original: de rnams thams cad ni rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin du gnas ma rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad ni rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin du gnas ma rnams so //
translated: All of them abide in the nature of the twenty-four nāḍīs.

original: gang spyan ma la sogs pa rnams dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: gang spyan ma la sogs pa rnams dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: Those are Locanā and so forth, the dakinis and so forth, the vajra women and so forth, and the vajra dakinis and so forth.

original: de rnams ni sum skor ma la sogs pa rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams ni sum skor ma la sogs pa rtsa bzhi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Those are the natures of the four root channels, the three channel-wheels and so forth.

original: rkyang ma dang ro ma dang kun 'dar ma rnams ni rdo rje snyems ma dang rdo rje phag mo dang bdag med ma dang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: rkyang ma dang ro ma dang kun 'dar ma rnams ni rdo rje snyems ma dang rdo rje phag mo dang bdag med ma dang ye shes mkha' 'gro ma'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: The lalanā, rasanā, and avadhūti are the natures of Vajragarvi, Vajravarahi, Nairātmya, and Jñānadākinī.

original: yang na 'dis ci ste /🔽gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbang las lha mo'i khyad par rnam par gzhan pa las gang ci yang rung rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams su rdo rje lha mo gsungs pa dpag tu med pa de rnams thams cad kyang so sor 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsa sum
analyzed: yang na 'dis ci ste / gdul bya'i bsam pa'i dbang las lha mo'i khyad par rnam par gzhan pa las gang ci yang rung rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams su rdo rje lha mo gsungs pa dpag tu med pa de rnams thams cad kyang so sor 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsa sum
translated: Or, what is the point of this?

original: cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin rnams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: cu rtsa gnyis kyi rang bzhin rnams su shes par bya'o //
translated: Whatever special goddesses are taught in the tantras of yogin and yoginī, in accordance with the power of the thoughts of those to be tamed, those goddesses are all the natures of the thirty-two individual channel-wheels.

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bdud 'dral ma ni aa wa dh'u t'i dang 'dres pa kho na ste /
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bdud 'dral ma ni aa wa dh'u t'i dang 'dres pa kho na ste /
translated: The thirty-second, the demoness channel, is just the mixture in the avadhūtī.

original: lce'i rtse mo ji srid par lte ba nas langs pa dus kyi rtsa rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos 'babs so //🔽de ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi 'bab po //
analyzed: lce'i rtse mo ji srid par lte ba nas langs pa dus kyi rtsa rnal 'byor ma rnams kyis 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi chos 'babs so // de ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi 'bab po //
translated: The dharma-flow, which has the characteristic of being blocked by the yoginīs, flows from the navel up to the tip of the tongue, which is the time channel.🔽That is the flow of the yoginīs.

original: de ni rnal 'byor ma sdud pas 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ni rnal 'byor ma sdud pas 'jug ste /
translated: That is the entry of the yoginīs’ gathering.

original: de ni ma rig pa'i ngo bo can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa'i ngo bo can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because it has the nature of ignorance.🔽But previously it was said,

original: 'on sngar / byang chub sems rnams sum cu gnyis /
analyzed: 'on sngar / byang chub sems rnams sum cu gnyis /
translated: “The bodhicitta flows in thirty-two channels

original: gang tshe 'dir ni gang bar 'gro //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dir ni gang bar 'gro //
translated: when it fills here.”

original: zhes dang / brtag pa gnyis par yang /
analyzed: zhes dang / brtag pa gnyis par yang /
translated: And in the second chapter it says,

original: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa'o zhes pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis 'bab pa'o zhes pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: “The bodhicitta flows in thirty-two channels.”

original: 'gal ba can nyid kyis dus kyi rtsa la 'bab pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba can nyid kyis dus kyi rtsa la 'bab pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: There is no error because it flows in the time channel by the power of the contradiction.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i ngo bor rtsa ston pa'i skabs su de ston pa ni yongs su spong ba'i don can no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i ngo bor rtsa ston pa'i skabs su de ston pa ni yongs su spong ba'i don can no //
translated: When the channels are taught in the context of being the nature of the yoginīs, that is taught in the sense of being abandoned.

original: de'i dbang nas 'jig rten 'di bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du skyes kyang de'i dkyil 'khor mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang nas 'jig rten 'di bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin du skyes kyang de'i dkyil 'khor mi mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, although this world is born with the nature of great bliss, it does not see that mandala.

original: de'i dbang kho na las 'chi ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i dbang kho na las 'chi ba yang ngo //
translated: And it is just by the power of that that there is death.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'bad pas kun gyi lhag ma sbang //
analyzed: 'bad pas kun gyi lhag ma sbang //
translated: By effort, all the rest is abandoned.

original: zhes so // 'gog pa'i chos 'bab pa la sogs pa 'di ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kho na ste /
analyzed: zhes so // 'gog pa'i chos 'bab pa la sogs pa 'di ni sgrib pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs kho na ste /
translated: This descent of the Dharma of cessation, etc. is only the occasion of obscuration.

original: sgrib pa med pa'i skabs su ni sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bdud 'dral ma yang byang chub @210b sems kyis gang ba'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i skabs su ni sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bdud 'dral ma yang byang chub @210b sems kyis gang ba'o //
translated: But in the occasion of non-obscuration, the thirty-two channel-petals are filled with the bodhicitta of the defeated demons.

original: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni kun gyi thabs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byang chub kyi sems rdo rje dpag tu med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni kun gyi thabs so //
translated: The Blessed One, the nature of the Tathagatas, etc. of the immeasurable vajra of bodhicitta, is the means of all.

original: 'di yang don dam par sa bon la sogs pa las bskyed pa med pa kho nar stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo ni rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa'o zhes so //🔽dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel ba /
analyzed: 'di yang don dam par sa bon la sogs pa las bskyed pa med pa kho nar stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems kyi ngo bo ni rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du gsungs pa'o zhes so // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel ba /
translated: This also is the nature of the bodhicitta of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, which is said to be the perfect maṇḍala, in the sense that ultimately there is no production from seeds and so forth.

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu gnyis pa'o /
translated: The twenty-second flower of the garland of instructions in the commentary on the glorious Heruka’s Tantra.

original: // / shes rab mchog gi rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i ched du 'dri ba /
analyzed: // / shes rab mchog gi rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa'i ched du 'dri ba /
translated: In order to teach extensively the maṇḍala and so forth of the perfection stage of supreme wisdom, he asks,

original: thos lags zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thos lags zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “I have heard” and so forth.

original: thos pa ni rab tu byed pa gnyis par mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa ni rab tu byed pa gnyis par mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: “Heard” is the brief explanation in the second chapter.

original: rtsa rnams kyi ngo bo ste rang gi ngo bo'i lha rnams kyis yang dag gzung ba ni lha'i rang bzhin du mos pas dri ma med pa nyid kyis na nges pa'i don rgyas par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi ngo bo ste rang gi ngo bo'i lha rnams kyis yang dag gzung ba ni lha'i rang bzhin du mos pas dri ma med pa nyid kyis na nges pa'i don rgyas par byas pa'o //
translated: The deities of the nature of the nāḍīs, the nature of the self, are “grasped” by the deities, which is to say, by the imagination of the nature of the deity. Since they are stainless, the definitive meaning is expanded.

original: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor dang bcas pa'i rtsa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the channels along with their retinue is

original: lus kyi dkyil 'khor nyams dga' ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi dkyil 'khor nyams dga' ba ste /
translated: the delightful body mandala,

original: he ru ka la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba chen po'i rim pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: he ru ka la sogs pa rnams kyi bde ba chen po'i rim pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abode of the stage of great bliss of Heruka and so forth.

original: ji skad gsungs pa ni brjod pa'i rim pa las ma 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa ni brjod pa'i rim pa las ma 'das pa ste /
translated: As it is said, it does not go beyond the stated stage.

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig par ni //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig par ni //
translated: In the twenty-first chapter,🔽the four doors are stated:

original: lus dang ngag gi sgo dag dang / sems kyi sgo yang mchog nyid kyis na rnam pa gnyis su byas pa zhes sgo bzhi rnams gsungs so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sgo dag dang / sems kyi sgo yang mchog nyid kyis na rnam pa gnyis su byas pa zhes sgo bzhi rnams gsungs so //
translated: “The doors of body, speech, and mind, and also the supreme, are made twofold.”

original: yan lag brgyad rnams ni mgo dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang lte ba dang snying ga dang kha rnams so //
analyzed: yan lag brgyad rnams ni mgo dang lag pa dang rkang pa dang lte ba dang snying ga dang kha rnams so //
translated: The eight limbs are the head, arms, legs, navel, heart, and mouth.

original: lte ba la sogs pa gcig ste rtsib logs gnyis kyang ngo zhes gzhan rnams so //
analyzed: lte ba la sogs pa gcig ste rtsib logs gnyis kyang ngo zhes gzhan rnams so //
translated: Others say that the navel and so forth are one, and the two sides are two.

original: dngos po kun gyis ni chu dang zheng du'o zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis ni chu dang zheng du'o zhes pa drang ba'i don to //
translated: All things are in terms of width and height. This is the interpretable meaning explanation.

original: stong pa nyid kyis zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis zhes pa nges pa'i don to //
translated: Emptiness is the definitive meaning explanation.

original: 'khor lo gsum bdag ni ji ltar nyi shu rtsa gcig par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum bdag ni ji ltar nyi shu rtsa gcig par bshad pa'o //
translated: The three wheels are explained as twenty-one.

original: 'khor lo gsum gcig ces 'don pa la //
analyzed: 'khor lo gsum gcig ces 'don pa la //
translated: The three wheels are one.

original: gcig ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: gcig ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: One is the mandala.

original: ri bo la sogs pa rnams dang bhee ram bha la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa las ma 'das pa zhes pa mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa rnams dang bhee ram bha la sogs pa rnams kyi rim pa las ma 'das pa zhes pa mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: Not beyond the sequence of mountains, etc., and the sequence of Bheruh, etc.

original: bla ma rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
analyzed: bla ma rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams te /
translated: The gurus are the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: de rnams kyi dus thams cad ni @211a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dus thams cad ni @211a * //
translated: All their times

original: man ngag brgyud pa'o //
analyzed: man ngag brgyud pa'o //
translated: are the lineage of instructions.

original: de ltar dkyil 'khor de ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dkyil 'khor de ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Thus, that mandala is for the sake of which

original: gnas te rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur pa ni rgyun can no //
analyzed: gnas te rang gi rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur pa ni rgyun can no //
translated: the place, arisen from one's own causes and conditions, is the continuum.

original: da lta nyid du bsgom pas rdzogs pa ni ma yin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
analyzed: da lta nyid du bsgom pas rdzogs pa ni ma yin te bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin no //
translated: It is not complete right now by meditation, like the mandala of the creation stage.

original: bhee ram bha la sogs pa rgyas par 'chad pa /
analyzed: bhee ram bha la sogs pa rgyas par 'chad pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of Bheruh, etc.

original: rkang pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkang pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The feet, etc.

original: gzhu'i dbyibs ni gzhu'i rnam pa can te /
analyzed: gzhu'i dbyibs ni gzhu'i rnam pa can te /
translated: The shape of a bow is the form of a bow.

original: rtsa'i bu gar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa'i bu gar gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it abides in the opening of the nāḍī.

original: ri bo la sogs pa rgyas par ston pa /
analyzed: ri bo la sogs pa rgyas par ston pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of the mountain, and so on:

original: sgal tshigs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgal tshigs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The spine, and so on,

original: ri rab ni mgo bo'i gnas so //
analyzed: ri rab ni mgo bo'i gnas so //
translated: means that Meru is the location of the head.

original: sngar rab tu gsal bar byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbyangs rnams dang gsal byed rnams kyi brgyad cu'i rang nyid ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sngar rab tu gsal bar byas pa'i rnam par gzhag pas sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dbyangs rnams dang gsal byed rnams kyi brgyad cu'i rang nyid ni mi gsal ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The thirty-two vowels and the eighty consonants, which were previously explained in detail, are the nature of the unclear nature.

original: de'i rgyun gyis zla ba dang nyi ma yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bos gnas pa ni rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems khu ba dang rngul cung zad kyi ngo bo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gdan du brjod de bskyed pa'i rim pa la'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyun gyis zla ba dang nyi ma yongs su gyur pa'i ngo bos gnas pa ni rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems khu ba dang rngul cung zad kyi ngo bo zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gdan du brjod de bskyed pa'i rim pa la'o //
translated: The moon and sun, which are the nature of the transformation of the continuum, are the moon maṇḍala, which is the bodhicitta, the nature of a little semen and sweat, and the seat of the thirty-two nāḍīs.

original: de 'dir glad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de 'dir glad pa kho na'o //
translated: That is the brain.🔽The thirty-two bodhicittas and the brain

original: de'i zhes pa byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dang glad pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa byang chub kyi sems sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi dang glad pa'i'o //
translated: are the moon.

original: ham yig ni ham gi dbyibs can rtsa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: ham yig ni ham gi dbyibs can rtsa la yang dag par zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: The syllable haṃ is the bodhicitta that has entered perfectly into the nāḍī that has the shape of haṃ.

original: gzhom du med pa ni spros pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: gzhom du med pa ni spros pa rnams kyis te /
translated: It is invincible by the proliferations,🔽because it is the nature of bliss that is of one taste with emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyis na rgyu rdo rje 'dzin pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is “the cause Vajradhara.”

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba rdo rje can gyis zhes so //
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba rdo rje can gyis zhes so //
translated: The one who is to be explained is the “Vajrin.”

original: gang phyir rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten ni phung po lnga rnams te /
analyzed: gang phyir rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten ni phung po lnga rnams te /
translated: Because the world with its roots is the five aggregates.

original: de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: They are also of two kinds.

original: de la brten pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la brten pa rnams ni mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Among them, the dependent ones are the eyes, etc.

original: g-yo ba rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: g-yo ba rnams ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The moving ones are the mind and mental factors.

original: thugs rdo rje ni dri za'i sems can gyi gnas skabs dor nas pha ma'i khu ba dang rdul dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i phan tshun phan gdags bya dang phan 'dogs pa po nyid kyis de lta de ltar gnas skabs yongs su 'gyur ba brgyud pa'i ngo bo'i
analyzed: thugs rdo rje ni dri za'i sems can gyi gnas skabs dor nas pha ma'i khu ba dang rdul dang lhan cig tu gyur pa'i phan tshun phan gdags bya dang phan 'dogs pa po nyid kyis de lta de ltar gnas skabs yongs su 'gyur ba brgyud pa'i ngo bo'i
translated: The mind-vajra, having abandoned the state of gandharva sentient being, is mutually benefited and benefactor, together with the father’s semen and the mother’s blood, and thus and thus, by the nature of the series of complete transformations,

original: phung po lnga rnams nye bar bskyed de /
analyzed: phung po lnga rnams nye bar bskyed de /
translated: generates the five aggregates.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs rnams su'o //
translated: In the states of birth and so forth.

original: 'on kyang bar gyi gnas skabs su @211b mgo bo'i mtsho skyes su khu ba shas che ba rdul shas chung ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bar gyi gnas skabs su @211b mgo bo'i mtsho skyes su khu ba shas che ba rdul shas chung ba ste /
translated: However, in the intermediate state, the semen is predominant in the lake-born of the head, and the blood is predominant in the secret lake-born.

original: gsang ba'i chu skyes su bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i chu skyes su bzlog pa'o //
translated: [The mind-vajra] is reversed in the secret lake-born.

original: sems bde ba'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig tu ci zhig ltar res 'ga' 'phel ba'am 'grib pa'o //
analyzed: sems bde ba'i ngo bo ni 'ga' zhig tu ci zhig ltar res 'ga' 'phel ba'am 'grib pa'o //
translated: The nature of the mind’s bliss is that sometimes somehow it increases or decreases.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated

original: gnas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gnas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: by “place” and so forth.

original: sa bon ni gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: sa bon ni gnas skabs gzhan dang gzhan gyis te /
translated: The seed is by other and other states,

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang ngo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang ngo //
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: gsal ba ni ji ltar rig par khu ba dang rdul bde ba rig pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: gsal ba ni ji ltar rig par khu ba dang rdul bde ba rig pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The clear is the nature of the awareness of the bliss of the semen and ovum as awareness.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i skabs 'phel ba na ni gsum ka yang shas cher 'jug pa ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i skabs 'phel ba na ni gsum ka yang shas cher 'jug pa ni gsal ba'o //
translated: When the occasion of the unchanging increases, all three are engaged in a greater way, which is the clear.

original: de nyid kyang kun rdzob pa kho na'i ngo bos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang kun rdzob pa kho na'i ngo bos te /
translated: That is also only by the nature of the relative.

original: gang gi phyir don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam par rang bzhin med pa nyid kyis mi gsal ba'i ngo bor gnas pa'o //
translated: Because in the ultimate, it is the nature of non-clarity by virtue of being without intrinsic nature.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bon 'di yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs kyi sa bon 'di yin zhe na /
translated: How is this the seed of the supramundane occasion?

original: gsungs pa / kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / kun gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: “of all…” and so forth.

original: lus can rnams kyi ni sgom pa po rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: lus can rnams kyi ni sgom pa po rnams kyi ste /
translated: Of embodied beings, that is, of meditators.

original: cig shos rnams kyi ni bdud rtsi 'dzag par rung ba'o //
analyzed: cig shos rnams kyi ni bdud rtsi 'dzag par rung ba'o //
translated: The other is suitable for the dripping of nectar.

original: gzugs ni rang gi ngo bo ste lus so //
analyzed: gzugs ni rang gi ngo bo ste lus so //
translated: Form is one’s own nature, the body.

original: de las ni ham yig las te skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo las so //
analyzed: de las ni ham yig las te skyes pa'i rang gi ngo bo las so //
translated: From that, from the letter haṃ, that is, from one’s own nature that has arisen,

original: bdud rtsi ngo bor 'di las 'dzag pa ni bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i rang gi ngo bo can te /
analyzed: bdud rtsi ngo bor 'di las 'dzag pa ni bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'i rang gi ngo bo can te /
translated: the dripping of nectar from this is the nature of the dripping of nectar.

original: ham yig ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo gang yang rung ba'i gtum mos gus pa dang bcas par bar ma chad par goms pa ni /
analyzed: ham yig ni gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo gang yang rung ba'i gtum mos gus pa dang bcas par bar ma chad par goms pa ni /
translated: The letter haṃ is the fire of passion, which is either clear or unclear, and one should practice it uninterruptedly with devotion.

original: chung du goms pa na bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'o //
analyzed: chung du goms pa na bdud rtsi 'dzag pa'o //
translated: When one is accustomed to it a little, the nectar drips.

original: bar man cher 'dzag go //
analyzed: bar man cher 'dzag go //
translated: When one is accustomed to it in the middle, it drips a lot.

original: chen por na rgyun mi 'chad par ches cher 'dzag go //
analyzed: chen por na rgyun mi 'chad par ches cher 'dzag go //
translated: When one is accustomed to it a lot, it drips very much, without interruption.

original: thabs kyi rgyud kyi ngo bo'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pas ni yid brtan pa na gtum mo nges par spro ba las 'bar zhing /
analyzed: thabs kyi rgyud kyi ngo bo'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pas ni yid brtan pa na gtum mo nges par spro ba las 'bar zhing /
translated: By meditating on the maṇḍala of the stage of completion, which is the nature of the method tantra, when the mind is stable, the fire of passion definitely blazes from the arousal,

original: des gsungs pa'i ri bong can yang 'dzag go //
analyzed: des gsungs pa'i ri bong can yang 'dzag go //
translated: and the moon of the nectar also drips.

original: de'i tshe yang de kho na ste ham yig 'dzag pa can gyi n'a da gtum mo rngul gyi ri mo 'byed cing khyad par du 'phags par byed de /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang de kho na ste ham yig 'dzag pa can gyi n'a da gtum mo rngul gyi ri mo 'byed cing khyad par du 'phags par byed de /
translated: At that time, that very fire of passion, the nāḍī that drips the letter haṃ, is distinguished by the opening of the lines of sweat.

original: 'dres par gyur pas bde ba dang ro gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pas bde ba dang ro gcig tu byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mixed, and it makes bliss and taste one.

original: 'di kho na me zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di kho na me zhes pa la sogs pas gsungs te /
translated: This is stated by “This very fire” and so on.

original: gtum mo'i me mnyes pa ni bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: gtum mo'i me mnyes pa ni bde ba'i rang bzhin nyid kho na'o //
translated: The fire of caṇḍālī is pleased with the nature of bliss alone.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽yongs rdzogs zhes pa la @212a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / yongs rdzogs zhes pa la @212a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa ste /
translated: “The complete,” etc.

original: des ni khyad par du thob pa'i ham yig gis yang dag rdzogs pa kho nar rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni khyad par du thob pa'i ham yig gis yang dag rdzogs pa kho nar rtsa'i 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: By that, the maṇḍala of the cakra is ascertained as complete and perfect with the special haṃ syllable.

original: med pa kho na'o zhes pa 'di la the tshom mam phyin ci log med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa kho na'o zhes pa 'di la the tshom mam phyin ci log med pa'o //
translated: There is no doubt or error here that it is nonexistent.

original: ci las 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa ;
analyzed: ci las 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa ;
translated: Why is this so? It is said:

original: de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “That,” etc.

original: de zhes pa phyi ma la ltos pas ma ning ngo //
analyzed: de zhes pa phyi ma la ltos pas ma ning ngo //
translated: The “that” is neuter because it refers to the future.

original: ham yig kho na khyad par thob pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas skabs khyad par ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir snying po ste /
analyzed: ham yig kho na khyad par thob pa ni phung po dang khams la sogs pa rnams kyi gnas skabs khyad par ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir snying po ste /
translated: The special haṃ syllable alone is the essence because it is the cause of the special state of the aggregates, elements, and so on.

original: bshad pa ni 'dir dang rgyud gzhan du'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni 'dir dang rgyud gzhan du'o //
translated: The explanation is here and in other tantras.

original: 'o na rtsa'i tshogs kyang snying po ste rgyas pa la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'o na rtsa'i tshogs kyang snying po ste rgyas pa la sogs pa byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: Well, the collection of nāḍīs is also the essence because it creates increase and so on.

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If it is said, “It is just as explained above,”

original: mchog ces pa ste /
analyzed: mchog ces pa ste /
translated: [the reply is] “supreme.”

original: ji ltar 'di mchog yin pa de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mchog yin pa de ltar 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be explained how this is supreme.

original: rtsa rnams kho na de len gyi lus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsa rnams kho na de len gyi lus ni ma yin te /
translated: The channels alone are the mandala, not the body,🔽so how can there be a mandala?

original: des na dkyil 'khor ga la yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na dkyil 'khor ga la yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The thirty-two” and so on.

original: ni ste gang gi phyir rtsa'i 'khor lo la dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir rtsa'i 'khor lo la dkyil 'khor te /
translated: That is, because the mandala is in the wheel of the channels.

original: de yang pags pa dang rus pa la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i lus su brjod cing /
analyzed: de yang pags pa dang rus pa la sogs pas yongs su bskor ba'i lus su brjod cing /
translated: Moreover, it is called the body, which is surrounded by skin, bones, and so on.

original: de'i phyir lus kyi dkyil 'khor du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi dkyil 'khor du 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted to be the mandala of the body.

original: de ltar yang bha ga dang lus dang byang sems kyi dbye ba las dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum gsungs shing /
analyzed: de ltar yang bha ga dang lus dang byang sems kyi dbye ba las dkyil 'khor rnam pa gsum gsungs shing /
translated: Thus, from the divisions of the bhaga, the body, and bodhicitta, three mandalas are explained.

original: de las bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ni bskyed pa'i rim pa kho na'o zhes pas gnyis 'dir rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: de las bha ga'i dkyil 'khor ni bskyed pa'i rim pa kho na'o zhes pas gnyis 'dir rgyas par bstan to //
translated: From that, since it is said that the bhaga mandala is only the stage of development, two are taught here in detail.

original: ci ste lus ni byang chub kyi sems len pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod mod /
analyzed: ci ste lus ni byang chub kyi sems len pa'i phyir dkyil 'khor du brjod mod /
translated: If the body is indeed called the maṇḍala because it takes up the bodhicitta,

original: byang chub sems ni ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems ni ci ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: how is the bodhicitta?

original: byang chub sems zhes pa ham yig khyad par du gyur pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes pa ham yig khyad par du gyur pa ni /
translated: The bodhicitta is the special syllable haṃ,

original: chen po yang ste stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: chen po yang ste stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir la /
translated: which is great because it is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion,

original: dga' ba rgyas par byed pa'i phyir rin po che yang yin pa bde ba chen po ni snying po ste /
analyzed: dga' ba rgyas par byed pa'i phyir rin po che yang yin pa bde ba chen po ni snying po ste /
translated: and it is a jewel because it expands the joy.🔽The essence is great bliss, which is the essence of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion.

original: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i snying po de de'i bdag nyid kyis len pa'i phyir byang chub sems kho na bla na med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //🔽ci ltar na 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa bde ba chen po'i snying po de de'i bdag nyid kyis len pa'i phyir byang chub sems kho na bla na med pa'i dkyil 'khor ro // ci ltar na 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Since that is taken up by its very nature, the bodhicitta alone is the unsurpassable maṇḍala.🔽How is it so?

original: de zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “it” and so on are as follows.

original: sna tshogs @212b ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sna tshogs @212b ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “Various” is twofold:

original: phyi dang nang ngo //
analyzed: phyi dang nang ngo //
translated: outer and inner.

original: khyab pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bos khyab bya dang de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab byed 'di yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bos khyab bya dang de'i bdag nyid kyis khyab byed 'di yin te /
translated: Pervasion is the pervasion of that by its own nature and the pervasion of that by its identity.

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba de ni phyi dang nang gis shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba de ni phyi dang nang gis shes pa'o //
translated: That will be explained, and it is known by the outer and inner.

original: dbang po thams cad 'jug byed pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po thams cad 'jug byed pa ni /
translated: The engagement of all the faculties is

original: dbang po rnams thams cad so so rang gi rnam shes bskyed pa la 'dis 'jug go zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dbang po rnams thams cad so so rang gi rnam shes bskyed pa la 'dis 'jug go zhes byas nas so //
translated: that all the faculties engage in the generation of their own consciousnesses.

original: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya gzugs la sogs pa don med pa ni phyi rol ma yin no zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzung bya gzugs la sogs pa don med pa ni phyi rol ma yin no zhes gsungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: This declares that the object of conceptualization, form, etc., which is meaningless, is not external.

original: grub pa yang de ste rdzogs pa yin gyis /
analyzed: grub pa yang de ste rdzogs pa yin gyis /
translated: It is also established, that is, complete,

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa bzhin du bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa bzhin du bskyed par bya ba ni ma yin no ;
translated: but it is not to be generated like the creation stage.

original: / rdzas kyang ste don bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: / rdzas kyang ste don bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is also substantial, that is, it performs a function.

original: rnam par gnas pa yang ste kun rdzob tu gnas gzhan du gnas pa lhur len pa khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa dang dbang po rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa yang ste kun rdzob tu gnas gzhan du gnas pa lhur len pa khu ba dang khrag la sogs pa dang dbang po rnams dang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: And also abiding, in the sense of abiding in the conventional, is the essence of the bodhisattva, which is the striving for the other shore, namely, semen, blood, and so on, the faculties, and the mind and mental factors.

original: 'di'i mchog nyid ni myur du skyes bu'i don gyi mchog 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'di'i mchog nyid ni myur du skyes bu'i don gyi mchog 'grub pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Its supremacy is due to its being the cause for quickly attaining the highest goal of a person.

original: de'i phyir de rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rtogs par byed pa /
translated: Therefore, it is that which causes one to realize

original: de zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the supreme, etc.

original: sbom po ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: sbom po ni gzugs kyi phung po'o //
translated: The gross is the form aggregate.

original: phra ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: phra ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po bzhi rnams so //
translated: The subtle is the four aggregates beginning with feeling.

original: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin med pa nyid do //
translated: Their nature is essencelessness.

original: gnyen nyid ni phan pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so ;
analyzed: gnyen nyid ni phan pa'i rgyu nyid kyis so ;
translated: The friend is the cause of benefit.

original: / khyad par gnyis kyis stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje can gyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: / khyad par gnyis kyis stong pa nyid dang / snying rje dbyer med pa la byang chub kyi sems rdo rje can gyi sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: The two special qualities are emptiness and compassion, which are inseparable. The reason for the use of the term “vajra of the enlightenment mind” is clarified.

original: de ltar na yang stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin lha'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lha sprul pa rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa'o zhes gsungs so
analyzed: de ltar na yang stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin lha'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i lha sprul pa rnams kyi sna tshogs pa'i don byed pa'o zhes gsungs so
translated: Thus, the mandala of the essence of the body in the nature of the deity’s form, which is the inseparability of emptiness and compassion, the nature of the mind of enlightenment, is the various activities of the various emanations of the deities.

original: // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi dam tshig ni rtog pa ste /
analyzed: // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste 'bras bu'i gnas skabs kyi dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste rgyu'i gnas skabs kyi dam tshig ni rtog pa ste /
translated: The pledge of the buddhas, that is, in the state of the result, and of the bodhisattvas, that is, in the state of the cause, is the imagination.

original: de las 'di dam tshig gi don byung zhing skyes so //
analyzed: de las 'di dam tshig gi don byung zhing skyes so //
translated: From that, this pledge arises and is born.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de rdo rje 'dzin pa nyid 'thob bo //
translated: One attains buddhahood, that is, the state of Vajradhara.

original: ci las she na /
analyzed: ci las she na /
translated: From what?

original: byung ba'i dkyil 'khor goms pa 'di kho na las so //🔽rang rgyal rnams kyi ste so so gcig pu sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'grub pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @213a * //
analyzed: byung ba'i dkyil 'khor goms pa 'di kho na las so // rang rgyal rnams kyi ste so so gcig pu sangs rgyas rnams kyi 'grub pa ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i @213a * //
translated: From this very imagination of the mandala of the origin.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: The accomplishment of the pratyekabuddhas, that is, the solitary buddhas, is perfect buddhahood.

original: mi khom pa spangs pa'i skye ba mi rnams kyis dang lha rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: mi khom pa spangs pa'i skye ba mi rnams kyis dang lha rnams kyi'o //
translated: The birth that has abandoned the unfavorable conditions is that of humans and gods.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi yang dkyil 'khor 'di goms par rung ba nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid kyang ngo zhes shes pa'i ched du /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi yang dkyil 'khor 'di goms par rung ba nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid kyang ngo zhes shes pa'i ched du /
translated: Also, for the śrāvakas and so forth, this maṇḍala is suitable for practice and also for buddhahood.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: In order to understand this, he says, “The śrāvakas,” and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig tu sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa sangs rgyas nyid du rung bar gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu sems can gyi phung po ma lus pa sangs rgyas nyid du rung bar gsungs pa ni /
translated: In some places, it is said that the entire mass of sentient beings is suitable for buddhahood.

original: mi khom par skyes pa rnams dal 'byor thob par gyur pa na'o zhes mngon par dgongs pas mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: mi khom par skyes pa rnams dal 'byor thob par gyur pa na'o zhes mngon par dgongs pas mi 'gal lo //
translated: This is not contradictory, since it is intended that those born in unfavorable states will obtain the leisures and opportunities.

original: mchod pa'i las dang sbyin sreg gi las rgyas par ston pa /
analyzed: mchod pa'i las dang sbyin sreg gi las rgyas par ston pa /
translated: The extensive explanation of the rite of worship and the rite of fire sacrifice

original: nang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is “the inner fire sacrifice,” and so on.

original: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: shes rab ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: Wisdom is the gnosis of emptiness.

original: de ni me ste lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'o //
analyzed: de ni me ste lhan cig skyes pa'i gtum mo'o //
translated: That is the fire, the coemergent caṇḍālī.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rab rib ma lus pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir cher 'bar ba ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rab rib ma lus pa sel bar byed pa'i phyir cher 'bar ba ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: It is blazing, that is, radiant, because it removes all the cataracts of conceptual thought.

original: de la nang du sbyin sreg ni khu ba la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: de la nang du sbyin sreg ni khu ba la sogs pa rnams kyi nang du 'dus pa'o //
translated: The inner fire offering is the gathering of semen and so forth.

original: phyi rol du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The outer is the offering of form and so forth.

original: phyi dang nang zhes pa'i tha snyad ni 'byung ba'i kun rdzob kyis te /
analyzed: phyi dang nang zhes pa'i tha snyad ni 'byung ba'i kun rdzob kyis te /
translated: The conventions of outer and inner are by the convention of the elements.

original: don dam par gnyis ka byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par gnyis ka byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: In reality, both are the nature of bodhicitta.

original: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bcom ldan 'das me lha la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems rdo rje bcom ldan 'das me lha la /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Vajra Bodhicitta

original: stong pa nyid dang bde ba'i rang bzhin snying rje'i rnal 'byor gyi mchod pa'i dgang blugs kyis /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bde ba'i rang bzhin snying rje'i rnal 'byor gyi mchod pa'i dgang blugs kyis /
translated: offers the oblation of the yoga of emptiness and compassion, which is the nature of bliss,🔽to the fire god.

original: de'i nang du rtogs pa'i skye mched drug la sogs pa rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i nang du rtogs pa'i skye mched drug la sogs pa rnams kyang mchod par 'gyur te /
translated: In that way, the six sense bases and so on are also offered.

original: khyad par du ste de kho na nyid kyi mchod pas so //
analyzed: khyad par du ste de kho na nyid kyi mchod pas so //
translated: It is special, that is, the offering of reality.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni rtsa rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni rtsa rnams so //
translated: The ḍākinīs are the nāḍīs.

original: des ni ste rnal 'byor kyis so //
analyzed: des ni ste rnal 'byor kyis so //
translated: That is, by the yogi.

original: de rnams ni lha'i ngo bo rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams ni lha'i ngo bo rnams so //
translated: Those are the essences of the deities.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Another arrangement is stated:

original: mgo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mgo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The head, etc.

original: bde ba chen po'i chu skyes su gnas pa'i khu ba ni sreg rdzas so //🔽ra sa n'a ni blugs gzar gyi yu ba ste de'i gdong padma'i 'dab ma'i dbyibs can gyi kha ni mgrin pa'i padma'o //🔽la la n'a ni dgang gzar gyi yu ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i chu skyes su gnas pa'i khu ba ni sreg rdzas so // ra sa n'a ni blugs gzar gyi yu ba ste de'i gdong padma'i 'dab ma'i dbyibs can gyi kha ni mgrin pa'i padma'o // la la n'a ni dgang gzar gyi yu ba ste /
translated: The essence that abides in the lotus of great bliss is the offering substance.🔽The mouth of the ladle, which is the face of the handle of the ladle, is the lotus of the throat.

original: de'i gdong ni snying ga'i padma'o //
analyzed: de'i gdong ni snying ga'i padma'o //
translated: The mouth of the funnel, which is the face of the handle of the funnel, is the lotus of the heart.

original: yu ba'i 'og rdo rje rin po che dang thab khung ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: yu ba'i 'og rdo rje rin po che dang thab khung ni lte ba'o //
translated: The vajra jewel below the handle and the hearth are the navel.

original: las ni yid mnyam par gzhag pa'am dbang po @213b gnyis kyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: las ni yid mnyam par gzhag pa'am dbang po @213b gnyis kyi bya ba'o //
translated: The action is the activity of the mind in equipoise or the activity of the two organs.

original: des bskul ba'i rlung ste /
analyzed: des bskul ba'i rlung ste /
translated: The wind that is impelled by that

original: des sbar ba'o //
analyzed: des sbar ba'o //
translated: is ignited by that.

original: tshangs pa'i de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i de kho na nyid ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes te /
translated: The reality of Brahmā is the gnosis of emptiness.

original: de de'i rang bzhin gyi me dro ba rngul gyi ngo bo rnal 'byor gyi gtum mo thab khung gi dbus kyi 'og gsang ba'i chu skyes su gnas so //
analyzed: de de'i rang bzhin gyi me dro ba rngul gyi ngo bo rnal 'byor gyi gtum mo thab khung gi dbus kyi 'og gsang ba'i chu skyes su gnas so //
translated: That is the nature of fire, which is the essence of sweat, the inner heat of yoga, abiding in the secret lotus below the center of the hearth.

original: sgra tsam ni gtum mo rdul gyi ri mo goms pa'i skabs na nang gi brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam ni gtum mo rdul gyi ri mo goms pa'i skabs na nang gi brjod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The mere sound is the inner expression when one is familiar with the dust-like lines of inner heat.

original: 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: slob dpon thugs rdo rje'i byang chub sems bsgom pas yid brtan pa na la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ru son pa'i rlung dag aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung gi nang du 'du'o //
analyzed: slob dpon thugs rdo rje'i byang chub sems bsgom pas yid brtan pa na la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ru son pa'i rlung dag aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung gi nang du 'du'o //
translated: When the mind is stabilized by the master through meditation on the bodhicitta of mind vajra, the winds that have entered lalana and rasanā enter the winds of avadhūtī.

original: de yang gtum mo sbor zhing /
analyzed: de yang gtum mo sbor zhing /
translated: That also ignites the inner heat.

original: de yang mgo bo'i 'khor los gnas nas sreg rdzas zhu bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang mgo bo'i 'khor los gnas nas sreg rdzas zhu bar byed do //
translated: That, abiding in the head cakra, causes the burning substances to melt.

original: de'i tshe ra sa n'a dang la la n'a'i rlung ma lus pa aa wa dh'u t'i ru zhugs shing /
analyzed: de'i tshe ra sa n'a dang la la n'a'i rlung ma lus pa aa wa dh'u t'i ru zhugs shing /
translated: At that time, all the winds of rasanā and lalana enter avadhūtī.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung yang tshangs pa'i me dang ro gcig cing de la 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i rlung yang tshangs pa'i me dang ro gcig cing de la 'jug par byed do //
translated: The winds of avadhūtī also become of one taste with the fire of Brahmā and enter that.

original: zhugs pa yang sbyin sreg gi mchod pa yang ste /🔽mngon par 'dod pa gnyis su med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhugs pa yang sbyin sreg gi mchod pa yang ste / mngon par 'dod pa gnyis su med pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The oblation is the worship.

original: de ltar yang dang yang du 'bar byed la sogs pa'o zhes pa skor bar byed pa ni bzlas pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang dang yang du 'bar byed la sogs pa'o zhes pa skor bar byed pa ni bzlas pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The repetition is the repetition of the mantra.

original: sgom pa ni snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor so sor snang ba so sor yang dang yang du rgyun mi 'chad par bskyed par bya bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa ni snying rje dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa'i byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin dkyil 'khor so sor snang ba so sor yang dang yang du rgyun mi 'chad par bskyed par bya bzhin pa'o //
translated: The meditation is the generation of the mandala, which is the nature of the innate bodhicitta, the nondual nature of compassion and wisdom, again and again, without interruption.

original: gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes pa la gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lhan cig skyes pa la gnas pa ni de'i bdag nyid kyis gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa lha rnams kyi dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The mandala of the deities, the aggregates of form and so forth, is the innate nature, because it is the nature of that.

original: sbyin sreg dang mchod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: sbyin sreg dang mchod pa yang ngo //
translated: The oblation and worship are also that.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ni dbang du byas pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po ni dbang du byas pa'i byang chub kyi sems rdo rje ste /
translated: The lord of the mandala is Vajra Bodhicitta, who is controlled.

original: de kho na ni bshad pa 'di thams cad rjes su sgrub bo //🔽'o na dri ba la dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras mngon par dgongs pa /
analyzed: de kho na ni bshad pa 'di thams cad rjes su sgrub bo // 'o na dri ba la dkyil 'khor mchod pa la sogs zhes pa'i sogs pa'i sgras mngon par dgongs pa /
translated: That alone is the proof of all these explanations.

original: rdul tshon gdab pa la sogs pa gzhan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rdul tshon gdab pa la sogs pa gzhan du gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in the question, the phrase “worship of the maṇḍala, etc.” includes the other topics taught elsewhere, such as the sprinkling of the colored powders, etc.

original: ci ltar 'dir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar 'dir rnam par ma bzhag ce na /
translated: How is it that they are not presented here?

original: gsungs pa / thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / thams cad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “everything, etc.”

original: 'dir ni ste rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la'o //🔽shes rab mchog la ni de las cig shos kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs @214a * //
analyzed: 'dir ni ste rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa la'o // shes rab mchog la ni de las cig shos kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs @214a * //
translated: Here, in the complete maṇḍala, etc.,

original: pa'i 'dzin pa gsal ba'i ched du cung zad 'dir rnam par gzhag cing gzhan ni rang nyid kyis dpyad nas rnam par gzhag par bya ba'am yang na ma yin te /
analyzed: pa'i 'dzin pa gsal ba'i ched du cung zad 'dir rnam par gzhag cing gzhan ni rang nyid kyis dpyad nas rnam par gzhag par bya ba'am yang na ma yin te /
translated: for the sake of clarifying the apprehension of the other maṇḍala, etc., a little is presented here, and the rest should be analyzed by oneself and presented.

original: de med kyang 'dir nyams pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pas gus par bya ba min no //
analyzed: de med kyang 'dir nyams pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pas gus par bya ba min no //
translated: Or, it is not so, because there is no deficiency here even if it is not so.🔽Thus, it is not to be respected by the intention.

original: de skad du yang dril bu zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang dril bu zhabs kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, Ghaṇṭapāda also says:

original: sems gnas las kyi thig dang ni //
analyzed: sems gnas las kyi thig dang ni //
translated: The mandala is the world itself,

original: rdul gdab rim pa las byung ba'i //
analyzed: rdul gdab rim pa las byung ba'i //
translated: arisen from the stages of the placement of the seed and the dust.

original: 'gro 'di dkyil 'khor kho na ste //🔽rang bzhin gyis grub gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro 'di dkyil 'khor kho na ste // rang bzhin gyis grub gnyis med pa'o //
translated: It is the mandala itself,🔽naturally existing, nondual.

original: bcos ma gnyis kyi ngo bo gang //
analyzed: bcos ma gnyis kyi ngo bo gang //
translated: The nature of the two fabricated [mandalas]

original: de ni gdul bya'i dbang las 'dod //
analyzed: de ni gdul bya'i dbang las 'dod //
translated: is accepted in terms of the power of the disciples.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i grub bya min //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i grub bya min //
translated: That is not to be accomplished by desire.

original: thar pa yang dag don mthong las //
analyzed: thar pa yang dag don mthong las //
translated: Liberation is from seeing the true meaning.

original: zhes so // ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs par dang bskyed pa'i rim pa la slob dpon rol par byed pa de ltar 'dir yang yin nam /
analyzed: zhes so // ji ltar phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor gyi khang pa la sogs par dang bskyed pa'i rim pa la slob dpon rol par byed pa de ltar 'dir yang yin nam /
translated: Just as the master plays in the outer mandala house and so forth and in the creation stage, is it so here?🔽Or is it otherwise?

original: rnam pa gzhan du yin zhes the tshom pas 'dri pa da dung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yin zhes the tshom pas 'dri pa da dung zhes pa ste /
translated: The question is asked with “still.”

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor du ci ltar zhes pa rol pa'i rnam pa dris pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor du ci ltar zhes pa rol pa'i rnam pa dris pa'o //
translated: “How in the mandala of the completion stage” asks about the form of the play.

original: bye brag ni khyad par te chos la sogs pa rnams kyis dang rang gi rten gyi yang ngo //
analyzed: bye brag ni khyad par te chos la sogs pa rnams kyis dang rang gi rten gyi yang ngo //
translated: “Distinction” is a difference, by means of the dharmas and so forth and their own support.

original: rten gyi bye brag gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten gyi bye brag gsungs pa /
translated: The distinction of the support is stated:

original: mgo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽ae yig rnam pa ni gru gsum ste /
analyzed: mgo zhes pa la sogs pa'o // ae yig rnam pa ni gru gsum ste /
translated: The head, etc.🔽The form of the letter E is a triangle.

original: bam yig 'dra ba ni zlum po thig le'o //
analyzed: bam yig 'dra ba ni zlum po thig le'o //
translated: The form of the letter Vaṃ is a circle, a drop.

original: brten pa'i bye brag gsungs pa /
analyzed: brten pa'i bye brag gsungs pa /
translated: The special supports are stated:

original: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dab ma drug cu rtsa bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The sixty-four petals, etc.

original: sprul pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sprul pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The characteristics of the emanation, etc., will be explained.

original: bye brag gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: bye brag gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Another distinction is stated:

original: sprul pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The emanation, etc.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste de'i dbus su dang 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ste chos kyi dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dang bde ba chen po'i yang ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste de'i dbus su dang 'chad par 'gyur ba yang ste chos kyi dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dang bde ba chen po'i yang ngo //
translated: The emanation wheel, in the middle of that, and also the one to be explained, i.e., the Dharma wheel, the enjoyment wheel, and the great bliss wheel.

original: rtsa'i dbyibs kho na 'khor lo nyid kyis dang padma nyid kyi tshul du bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtsa'i dbyibs kho na 'khor lo nyid kyis dang padma nyid kyi tshul du bya ba'o //
translated: The shape of the channel is the wheel itself, and the lotus itself.

original: sde chen brgyad la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas bzhi pa dang nyi shu gnyis par bshad do //
analyzed: sde chen brgyad la sogs pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pas bzhi pa dang nyi shu gnyis par bshad do //
translated: The nature, etc., of the eight great classes, etc., are explained in the fourth and twenty-second chapters by the perfection stage.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la bsgom par bya ba rnams ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la 'jug pa la thabs nyid du 'dir rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la bsgom par bya ba rnams ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la 'jug pa la thabs nyid du 'dir rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Those things to be cultivated in the creation stage are taught here extensively as the means for engaging in the completion stage.

original: sde tshan brgyad la sogs pa rnams @214b ni bris pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: sde tshan brgyad la sogs pa rnams @214b ni bris pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The eight groups, etc., are the written entities.

original: de la lte bar gyen du kha phyogs pa'i chu skyes dmar po la /
analyzed: de la lte bar gyen du kha phyogs pa'i chu skyes dmar po la /
translated: There, in the navel, on the upward-facing lotus,

original: sde tshan rnams kho na brgyad do zhes pas shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i sde pa rnams te sngar rnam par phye'o //
analyzed: sde tshan rnams kho na brgyad do zhes pas shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la aa ka tsa ta ta pa ya sha'i sde pa rnams te sngar rnam par phye'o //
translated: the eight groups are just the eight groups. On the petals of the east, etc., are the groups of a ka ca ṭa ta pa ya śa, as previously analyzed.

original: kha cig tu rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pa aa ka la sogs pa yi ge brgyad dgod pa gsungs pa ni gdul bya'i ngor te /
analyzed: kha cig tu rnam par thar pa brgyad rnam par dag pa aa ka la sogs pa yi ge brgyad dgod pa gsungs pa ni gdul bya'i ngor te /
translated: In some places, it is said that the eight letters a ka, etc., are the arrangement of the eight liberations, which are pure.

original: de'i phyir sde tshan brgyad rnams so zhes kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sde tshan brgyad rnams so zhes kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the eight groups are also so.

original: dbus su zla ba la aam ste 'gyur ba med pa dam pa ni skye ba med pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus su zla ba la aam ste 'gyur ba med pa dam pa ni skye ba med pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the center, on the moon, is aṃ, the supreme unchanging, because it illuminates the unborn.

original: snying gar kha thur du phyogs pa'i padma dkar por zla ba la h'um ste /
analyzed: snying gar kha thur du phyogs pa'i padma dkar por zla ba la h'um ste /
