translated: In the heart, on a white lotus facing downward, on a moon, is hūṃ.

original: mi shigs pa ni spros pa rnams kyis te chos sku mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi shigs pa ni spros pa rnams kyis te chos sku mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The indestructible is the elaborations, because it illustrates the dharmakāya.

original: mi shigs pa brjod pas ham yig tu dogs pa sel ba la lnga zhes pa'i grangs kyi tshig ste /
analyzed: mi shigs pa brjod pas ham yig tu dogs pa sel ba la lnga zhes pa'i grangs kyi tshig ste /
translated: The word “five” is for dispelling the doubt that the indestructible is the syllable haṃ.

original: au yig 'og na gnas pa dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: au yig 'og na gnas pa dang lhan cig go //
translated: It is together with the syllable u that is below.

original: des na shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la a'a a'i a'a a'u aee dbyangs rnams so //
analyzed: des na shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la a'a a'i a'a a'u aee dbyangs rnams so //
translated: Therefore, on the petals of the east, etc., are the vowels a, ā, i, ī, u, ū, ṛ, ṝ, ḷ, ḹ, e, ai, o, au, and am.

original: dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
analyzed: dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
translated: On the petals of Isana, etc., are the consonants ya, ra, la, and va.

original: mgrin par steng du phyogs pa'i chu skyes dmar po la zla bar aom ste shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la a'a a'i a'a a'u aee cha rnams so //
analyzed: mgrin par steng du phyogs pa'i chu skyes dmar po la zla bar aom ste shar la sogs pa'i 'dab ma rnams la a'a a'i a'a a'u aee cha rnams so //
translated: In the throat, on a red lotus facing upward, on a moon, is oṃ. On the petals of the east, etc., are the parts a, ā, i, ī, u, ū, ṛ, ṝ, ḷ, ḹ, e, ai, o, au, and aṃ.

original: ya ra la wa rnams kyis zhes rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
analyzed: ya ra la wa rnams kyis zhes rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir dbang ldan la sogs pa rnams su ya ra la wa rnams so //
translated: Because of the suffix “etc.,” on the petals of Isana, etc., are the consonants ya, ra, la, and va.

original: mgo bor 'og tu phyogs pa'i sna tshogs mtsho skyes su zla ba la ham yig mgo bo stong pa ste zla ba phyed dang thig le dang n'a da dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bor 'og tu phyogs pa'i sna tshogs mtsho skyes su zla ba la ham yig mgo bo stong pa ste zla ba phyed dang thig le dang n'a da dang ldan pa'o //
translated: On the head, facing downward, is a variegated lotus with a haṃ syllable, upside down, that is, with the crescent and drop and the nada.

original: nyi shu rtsa gnyis par gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gnyis par gsungs pa /
translated: The Twenty-Two

original: ham yig 'di //
analyzed: ham yig 'di //
translated: This haṃ syllable

original: n'a da dang thig le gzhom du med pa'o //
analyzed: n'a da dang thig le gzhom du med pa'o //
translated: has an indestructible nada and drop.

original: zhes so // gcig gis bar du chod pa'i 'dab ma bcu drug rnams su dbyangs bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: zhes so // gcig gis bar du chod pa'i 'dab ma bcu drug rnams su dbyangs bcu drug rnams so //
translated: On the sixteen petals, separated by one space, are the sixteen vowels.

original: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge 'di rnams zla phyed dang thig le dang bcas pa pa mo lta bu 'dzag pa rnams so zhes shes par bya ste /🔽khyad par dang bcas pa ni gtum mo bsgom pa na bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: aa yig la sogs pa'i yi ge 'di rnams zla phyed dang thig le dang bcas pa pa mo lta bu 'dzag pa rnams so zhes shes par bya ste / khyad par dang bcas pa ni gtum mo bsgom pa na bshad par bya'o //
translated: These syllables, beginning with a, are to be known as having crescents and drops, like a dripping water-pot.🔽With a difference, this will be explained in the meditation on caṇḍālī.

original: dkyus ma la ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dkyus ma la ni zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In the ordinary [practice], it is said [in the text]:

original: ngos dag ni h'um yig gi ngos so //
analyzed: ngos dag ni h'um yig gi ngos so //
translated: The sides are the sides of the syllable hūṃ.

original: g-yon dang g-yas dag ni rlung dag ste la la n'a dang ra wa n'a ru son pa dag dang / khu ba dang rngul dag kyang ngo //🔽la la n'a dang @215a * //
analyzed: g-yon dang g-yas dag ni rlung dag ste la la n'a dang ra wa n'a ru son pa dag dang / khu ba dang rngul dag kyang ngo // la la n'a dang @215a * //
translated: The left and right channels are the two winds, lalanā and rasanā, and also semen and sweat.

original: ra sa n'a'i rtsa dag ni mgo bo'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i 'khor lor ji srid par mdud pa rnams su lcags sgrog gi rnam pas aa wa dh'u t'i la 'khyud nas gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: ra sa n'a'i rtsa dag ni mgo bo'i 'khor lo nas gsang ba'i 'khor lor ji srid par mdud pa rnams su lcags sgrog gi rnam pas aa wa dh'u t'i la 'khyud nas gnas pa dag go //
translated: The lalanā and rasanā channels, from the head cakra to the secret cakra, are coiled around the avadhūti like iron clasps at the knots.

original: 'on kyang la la n'a ni zos pa dang 'thungs pa lto ba'i mes smin pa rnams las khu ba 'bab po zhes pas mgrin pa nas zhes dang ngal so zhes gsungs kyi de dag kho na'i mthar thug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang la la n'a ni zos pa dang 'thungs pa lto ba'i mes smin pa rnams las khu ba 'bab po zhes pas mgrin pa nas zhes dang ngal so zhes gsungs kyi de dag kho na'i mthar thug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, the lalanā is said to be the channel that descends from the throat and rests in the secret cakra, and it is said to be the channel that brings down semen from the stomach fire that digests what is eaten and drunk. It is not that it ends there alone.

original: de nyid kyi phying yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phying yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is also said to be the channel that brings down semen.

original: myos byed kyang 'bebs te /
analyzed: myos byed kyang 'bebs te /
translated: It also brings down alcohol.

original: spros pas gso'o //
analyzed: spros pas gso'o //
translated: It is nourished by elaboration.

original: ra sa n'a ni zhu ba las khrag 'bebs te /
analyzed: ra sa n'a ni zhu ba las khrag 'bebs te /
translated: The rasanā brings down blood from the melted substances.

original: dang por lte bar dang mgrin par ji srid par ro zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang por lte bar dang mgrin par ji srid par ro zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said to be the channel that descends from the navel to the throat.

original: lte ba nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lte ba nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “From the navel” and so forth.

original: yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ngal so ba yang ngo //
analyzed: yang rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ngal so ba yang ngo //
translated: And because it is engaged, it is also the resting place.

original: des na de'i khrag gis lus la mngon par khyab bo //
analyzed: des na de'i khrag gis lus la mngon par khyab bo //
translated: Therefore, the blood pervades the body.

original: zla ba ni khu ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba ni khu ba'o //
translated: The moon is the semen.

original: 'jug pa'i rlung 'og gi sgo dang 'byung ba steng gi sgo ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a la mnyam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rlung 'og gi sgo dang 'byung ba steng gi sgo ni la la n'a dang ra sa n'a la mnyam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The downward-moving wind is the lower door, and the upward-moving wind is the upper door.

original: rlung gnyis ji ltar sgo yin zhe na /
analyzed: rlung gnyis ji ltar sgo yin zhe na /
translated: How are the two winds doors?

original: ni ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir /
translated: “Indeed,” i.e., because

original: 'di dag ste brjod pa dag brten pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ste brjod pa dag brten pa dag go //
translated: these two are the supports.🔽The two doors of the principal moon and sun are the two doors of this wind.

original: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gtso bo'i sgo gnyis su gyur pa rlung 'di'i sgo gnyis ni so sor rtsa gnyis so //
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma dag gi gtso bo'i sgo gnyis su gyur pa rlung 'di'i sgo gnyis ni so sor rtsa gnyis so //
translated: Each of the two channels is a door.

original: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar btags pa las la la n'a zla bar brjod cing ra sa n'a nyi mar ro //🔽'di dag sgo nyid du rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nye bar btags pa las la la n'a zla bar brjod cing ra sa n'a nyi mar ro // 'di dag sgo nyid du rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in the Upāyikā, the lalana is called the moon and the rasanā is called the sun.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: In order to understand that these are doors, it is said, “the hero,” and so on.

original: dpa' bo khu ba'i rnam pa rnams kyis dang mkha' 'gro ma bde ba'i tshul dang khrag gi tshul te /
analyzed: dpa' bo khu ba'i rnam pa rnams kyis dang mkha' 'gro ma bde ba'i tshul dang khrag gi tshul te /
translated: The heroes are in the form of semen, and the dakinis are in the form of bliss and blood.

original: de dang ldan pa rlung la zhon pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi rgyu ste rten dag go //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa rlung la zhon pa rnams kyi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gi rgyu ste rten dag go //
translated: The channels are the cause, the support, of the going and coming of those who ride the winds, who possess those.

original: rgyud dag ces pa ni lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud dag ces pa ni lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The channels are pure because of the scriptures.

original: yang na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gang dag gi nges 'brel dag ste dgos pa dag go zhes kyang tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang na 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dag gang dag gi nges 'brel dag ste dgos pa dag go zhes kyang tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Or else, the going and coming are the connections, the purposes, of those. The words are also to be applied in this way.

original: ni ste gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams kyi rtsa so sor phyi rol du 'gro ba na nub pa ste nub par 'gro ba dang sdud pa dang thim pa ste gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams kyi rtsa so sor phyi rol du 'gro ba na nub pa ste nub par 'gro ba dang sdud pa dang thim pa ste gnyid log pa'i gnas skabs bzhin no //
translated: And is because, when the channels go outside individually, they set, that is, they go to set, and they gather, that is, they dissolve, like in the state of sleep.

original: nang du 'ong ba dang 'char ba dang spro ba ste sad pa'i skabs na bzhin no //
analyzed: nang du 'ong ba dang 'char ba dang spro ba ste sad pa'i skabs na bzhin no //
translated: When they come inside, they rise and spread, like in the state of waking.

original: gang la la n'a spro ba'i rtsa dang ra sa n'a sdud pa'i rtsar brjod pa de ni rim pa ji lta @215b bar khu ba dang rdul shas che ba dag 'bab pa'i phyir zhes phal che bar gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la la n'a spro ba'i rtsa dang ra sa n'a sdud pa'i rtsar brjod pa de ni rim pa ji lta @215b bar khu ba dang rdul shas che ba dag 'bab pa'i phyir zhes phal che bar gsungs pa'o //
translated: The one called the lalana channel of joy and the rasanā channel of gathering are said to be the channels of the flow of semen and blood, respectively, in most cases.

original: a'a li dang k'a li dag gi yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rgyu dag ni de dag go zhes rtogs pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li dag gi yang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba'i rgyu dag ni de dag go zhes rtogs pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to understand that the causes of the going and coming of the āli and kāli are those two, it is said:

original: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The left and right channels” and so on.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i'i g-yon ni la la n'a dang / g-yas ngos ni /
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i'i g-yon ni la la n'a dang / g-yas ngos ni /
translated: The left side of the avadhūti is the lalana, and the right side

original: ra sa n'a ste /
analyzed: ra sa n'a ste /
translated: is the rasanā.

original: kun sdud pa'i zlas dbye ba'o //
analyzed: kun sdud pa'i zlas dbye ba'o //
translated: The two are distinguished by the gathering of all.🔽From among the sixteen vowels, the twelve vowels without the neutral ones, ri, ri, li, and li,

original: dbyangs bcu drug rnams kyi nang nas ri r'i li l'i ste ma ning dang bral ba dbyangs bcu gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: dbyangs bcu drug rnams kyi nang nas ri r'i li l'i ste ma ning dang bral ba dbyangs bcu gnyis rnams so //
translated: are the “twelve circles.”

original: bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba ste /
analyzed: bskor ba ni yongs su bskor ba ste /
translated: “Circling” means completely surrounding.

original: 'og tu bltas pa'i ka sogs rnams kyis so //
analyzed: 'og tu bltas pa'i ka sogs rnams kyis so //
translated: They are “facing down” because they are the ka and so on.

original: g-yon dang cig shos kyi ngos su gnas pa'i rtsa dag gi dbus aa wa dh'u t'i ru bya ba dpa' bo la sogs pa'i khams rgyas pa la sogs pa ste der nges par byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: g-yon dang cig shos kyi ngos su gnas pa'i rtsa dag gi dbus aa wa dh'u t'i ru bya ba dpa' bo la sogs pa'i khams rgyas pa la sogs pa ste der nges par byas pa rnams so //
translated: The channels on the left and right sides are called the rasanā and lalanā, respectively.🔽The middle one is the avadhūtī.

original: dbus smos pas ni aa wa dh'u t'i ru yang a'a li dang k'a li dag 'bab par gsal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: dbus smos pas ni aa wa dh'u t'i ru yang a'a li dang k'a li dag 'bab par gsal bar mdzad do //
translated: The rasanā and lalanā are the a and kā of the avadhūtī.

original: srin po ni gtum mo ste /
analyzed: srin po ni gtum mo ste /
translated: The rasanā is the caṇḍālī,

original: dus kyi me'i rang bzhin nyid kyis phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du za bar rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir srin po lta bu'o //
analyzed: dus kyi me'i rang bzhin nyid kyis phung po la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i bdag nyid du za bar rung ba nyid du mtshungs pa'i phyir srin po lta bu'o //
translated: because it is suitable to consume the aggregates and so on in the nature of the fire of time, since it is similar to a cannibal.

original: 'og gi cha rnams su ste lte ba'i 'o //
analyzed: 'og gi cha rnams su ste lte ba'i 'o //
translated: The rasanā is below, at the navel.

original: 'di skad bshad de la la n'a ra dang ra sa n'a ra dang aa wa dh'u t'i ru yang rlung 'byung ba na steng du phyogs pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin mi gsal ba'i ngo bo can dbyangs bcu drug dang ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum ma
analyzed: 'di skad bshad de la la n'a ra dang ra sa n'a ra dang aa wa dh'u t'i ru yang rlung 'byung ba na steng du phyogs pa'i rlung gi rang bzhin mi gsal ba'i ngo bo can dbyangs bcu drug dang ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum ma
translated: The winds that arise in the rasanā, lalanā, and avadhūtī are the winds that move upward. They are of the nature of the winds. They are the sixteen vowels and the thirty-three consonants.

original: 'khrugs pa dang 'khrugs pa rnams /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa dang 'khrugs pa rnams /
translated: The disturbed and undisturbed

original: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pas re rer yang khams rnams 'byin par byed sdud par byed do //
analyzed: rim pa dang rim pa ma yin pas re rer yang khams rnams 'byin par byed sdud par byed do //
translated: elements are emitted and gathered in each one, in order and out of order.

original: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bsal bar gyur pa ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'di rnams kyang sna tshogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtogs pa bsal bar gyur pa ni de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir 'di rnams kyang sna tshogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since the various conceptualizations are removed, these also arise as various.

original: 'jug pa na ni 'og tu phyogs pa rnams de ltar kho nar 'jug par byed spro bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jug pa na ni 'og tu phyogs pa rnams de ltar kho nar 'jug par byed spro bar byed do //
translated: When entering, those that face downward enter and expand in just that way.🔽The first channels are the la la ksha of the ra ra, which are the winds dissolving.

original: rtsa dang po dag ni ri r'i la l'i ksha rnams rlung la thim pa rnams 'bab kyi shas cher ni ma yin no zhes pas de rnams dor ba dag tu gsungs te /
analyzed: rtsa dang po dag ni ri r'i la l'i ksha rnams rlung la thim pa rnams 'bab kyi shas cher ni ma yin no zhes pas de rnams dor ba dag tu gsungs te /
translated: Since they are not predominant, they are said to be discarded.

original: dper na a'a li kho na shas cher 'bab pa'i phyir a'a li la la n'a dang / k'a li kho na'i phyir k'a li ra sa n'a zhes gzhan du gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na a'a li kho na shas cher 'bab pa'i phyir a'a li la la n'a dang / k'a li kho na'i phyir k'a li ra sa n'a zhes gzhan du gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, since the āli is predominant, it is said elsewhere that the āli is the nāḍī of the lavaṇa, and since it is only the kāli, it is the kāli of the rasana.

original: yi ge thams cad kyang shas cher gyur pa 'bab pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
analyzed: yi ge thams cad kyang shas cher gyur pa 'bab pa ni aa wa dh'u t'i'o //
translated: All the syllables are predominant, and the one that flows is the avadhūti.

original: ksha ni thim ste de ni shas cher gyur pa 'og @216a * //
analyzed: ksha ni thim ste de ni shas cher gyur pa 'og @216a * //
translated: Kṣa is dissolution, which is mostly the earth element.🔽

original: tu cha rnams su lhag par gnas par gsungs so //
analyzed: tu cha rnams su lhag par gnas par gsungs so //
translated: Kṣa is dissolution, and that is predominantly śa, which is said to abide in the parts below.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang bcas pa'i thabs dag snyoms par 'jug pas la la n'i'i rlung dag aa wa dh'u t'i ru 'jug pa na gtum mo 'bar ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes rab dang bcas pa'i thabs dag snyoms par 'jug pas la la n'i'i rlung dag aa wa dh'u t'i ru 'jug pa na gtum mo 'bar ro //
translated: Therefore, when the winds of the left and right channels enter the avadhūtī through the union of method and wisdom, caṇḍālī blazes.

original: de yang phung po la sogs pa bsreg cing spyi bor zla ba 'ju bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang phung po la sogs pa bsreg cing spyi bor zla ba 'ju bar byed do //
translated: That burns the aggregates and so forth and causes the moon at the crown to melt.

original: de zhu ba yang de dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin mgrin par 'bab po //
analyzed: de zhu ba yang de dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba'i rang bzhin mgrin par 'bab po //
translated: That melting, which is of the same taste as that, falls to the throat as the nature of bliss.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa gang tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa gang tshe zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said, “When the great passion,” and so on.

original: chags chen ni bde ba chen po dga' ba rab tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: chags chen ni bde ba chen po dga' ba rab tu gyur pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Great passion is the state of the transformation of joy, which is great bliss.

original: longs spyod ni bde ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod ni bde ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Enjoyment is the experience of bliss.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'i bdag nyid rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of the buddhas is the nature of the form aggregate and so on, Vairocana and so on.

original: rim gyis 'bab bzhin pa ni shes rab ma'i sna'i rtse mo dang / thabs kyi rdo rje'i rtse mor te nor bur gang gi tshe gnas pa de'i tshe shin tu ches longs spyod rdzogs par bshad do zhes snga ma dang 'brel te /
analyzed: rim gyis 'bab bzhin pa ni shes rab ma'i sna'i rtse mo dang / thabs kyi rdo rje'i rtse mor te nor bur gang gi tshe gnas pa de'i tshe shin tu ches longs spyod rdzogs par bshad do zhes snga ma dang 'brel te /
translated: The one who is gradually descending is the wisdom consort, and when she is located at the tip of the nose and at the tip of the jewel of the method vajra, then it is explained as the very great enjoyment body.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is connected to the previous verse.🔽Because the innate joy is enjoyed.

original: gang gi tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang sna'i rtse mo las dang rdo rje'i rtse mo las 'phos shing nub pa ni bde ba nyams su myong ba rnam par 'chad pa'i phyir na /🔽de'i tshe shes rab kyi bha ga'i padma'i nang du son pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang sna'i rtse mo las dang rdo rje'i rtse mo las 'phos shing nub pa ni bde ba nyams su myong ba rnam par 'chad pa'i phyir na / de'i tshe shes rab kyi bha ga'i padma'i nang du son pa ni /
translated: When the enjoyment body has moved from the tip of the nose and from the tip of the vajra and has disappeared,

original: 'gro zhing 'gro'o zhes pa nyungs kar te lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro zhing 'gro'o zhes pa nyungs kar te lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: then it is said that it has gone and gone into the lotus of the bhaga of the wisdom consort.

original: yungs kar brjod pas yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam phra mo'i rnal 'byor la bsgom par bya'o zhes par byas so //
analyzed: yungs kar brjod pas yungs kar gyi 'bras bu'i tshad tsam phra mo'i rnal 'byor la bsgom par bya'o zhes par byas so //
translated: Because of the statement “sesame seed,” it is cultivated in the yoga of the subtle, which is the size of a sesame seed.

original: de gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de gsungs pa ;
translated: That is stated:

original: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
analyzed: rin chen chen po kha dog lnga //
translated: The great jewel is five-colored,

original: yungs kar gyi ni 'bru tshod tsam //🔽sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
analyzed: yungs kar gyi ni 'bru tshod tsam // sna yi rtse mor nan tan du //
translated: the size of a mustard seed.🔽One should always meditate on it

original: rnal 'byor las ni rtag tu bsgom //
analyzed: rnal 'byor las ni rtag tu bsgom //
translated: with effort at the tip of the nose.

original: zhes so // ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dkar po la sogs pa kha dog lnga'o //🔽rnal 'byor las ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: zhes so // ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir dkar po la sogs pa kha dog lnga'o // rnal 'byor las ni shes rab dang thabs snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
translated: Because it has the nature of the five intuitions, it is five-colored, white, etc.

original: rtag tu ni mtshan ma 'byung gi bar du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ni mtshan ma 'byung gi bar du'o //
translated: One should always meditate on it until the sign arises.

original: nyi ma'i gzugs ni rngul mang po 'dres pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i gzugs ni rngul mang po 'dres pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: The sun form is because of the mixture of much sweat.

original: bar do'i srid pa las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: bar do'i srid pa las skyes pa'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa ni sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The emanation body is the one born from the intermediate state existence, along with consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir phung po rnams dang mig @216b la sogs pa rnams des spro ba ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po rnams dang mig @216b la sogs pa rnams des spro ba ni sprul pa'o //
translated: Because the aggregates and eyes, etc. are emanated by that, it is emanation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skye gnas kyi padmar spro ba'i gar gyis dbang byed pa'i phyir padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skye gnas kyi padmar spro ba'i gar gyis dbang byed pa'i phyir padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //
translated: Therefore, because it is the lord of the dance of emanation in the womb lotus, it is the lotus dance lord.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams rgyas pa la sogs pa bskyed pas smin par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams rgyas pa la sogs pa bskyed pas smin par byed pa'i phyir rgyal po'o //
translated: Since the aggregates and so forth are ripened by the generation of the development and so forth, it is the king.

original: gang gi tshe yang ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems goms pa yid brtan pa phul du byung ba las 'pho ba med cing nyi ma yang nub ste mi mthong ba dang mi skye ba kho nar 'gro ba de'i tshe gang 'byung ba de gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang ji skad bshad pa'i byang chub kyi sems goms pa yid brtan pa phul du byung ba las 'pho ba med cing nyi ma yang nub ste mi mthong ba dang mi skye ba kho nar 'gro ba de'i tshe gang 'byung ba de gsungs pa /
translated: When, moreover, the steadfast, excellent cultivation of the enlightenment mind as explained above is without transference and the sun sets and is not seen, and it goes only to non-arising, then what occurs is stated:

original: de ru zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ru zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “There,” and so on.

original: nyi ma gzhan ni lte ba'i 'og tu gnas pa ste de dang bcas pa ni yod do zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan ni lte ba'i 'og tu gnas pa ste de dang bcas pa ni yod do zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The other sun is located below the navel, and it is said that it exists along with that.

original: gang rtogs pa'i don can du gsungs pa de rtogs par gyur cing gong bur gyur pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyis na /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa'i don can du gsungs pa de rtogs par gyur cing gong bur gyur pa stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa nyid kyis lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid kyis na /
translated: That which is stated to have the meaning of realization is realized and becomes a whole, by the indivisibility of emptiness and compassion, and by the nature of the innate great bliss.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis de nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis de nye bar longs spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aggregates and so on are of one taste with it, they are enjoyed in it.

original: de rnams kyi yang gnas skabs kyi khyad par sprul pa las /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang gnas skabs kyi khyad par sprul pa las /
translated: And because of the special state of those, the emanation

original: chos dang bde ba chen po dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku bzhi ro gcig par gyur pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang bde ba chen po dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku bzhi ro gcig par gyur pa ni /
translated: is of one taste with the four bodies of reality, beatitude, full endowment, and emanation.

original: rnyog pa med pa ste nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnyog pa med pa ste nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free of turbidity, because it is free of the turbidity of the addictions.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba'i lam 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / 'pho ba yang 'dis rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'khor ba'i lam 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / 'pho ba yang 'dis rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: And so, the path of cyclic life, with its attachments and so on, is eliminated by it.

original: spros pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
analyzed: spros pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa ste /
translated: The conceptual elaboration is the obscuration of the knowable.

original: de 'dir nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dir nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: It is pacified here.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba ste dge ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba ste dge ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is peace, which is good.

original: ci ltar nye bar zhi ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar nye bar zhi ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it pacified?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po la sogs par 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po la sogs par 'dzin pa gnyis spangs pa'o //
translated: Because it is free of the two graspings, of substantiality, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mchog 'jig rten las 'das ba'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mchog 'jig rten las 'das ba'i phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the supreme, supramundane excellence.

original: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i'o //
analyzed: stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i'o //
translated: The nature of the powers, fearlessnesses, etc.

original: dag pa ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags cha shas dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag pa ni sgrib pa gnyis kyi bag chags cha shas dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Pure, because it is free from the propensities of the two obstructions.

original: bshad pa ni rgyud gzhan rnams su yang ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa ni rgyud gzhan rnams su yang ngo //
translated: It is explained in other tantras.

original: rgyud ni 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
analyzed: rgyud ni 'bras bu'i rgyud do //
translated: The tantra is the causal tantra.

original: dgod dang lha dang lag bcangs rgyud //
analyzed: dgod dang lha dang lag bcangs rgyud //
translated: The tantra of laughter, the tantra of looking, the tantra of embracing.

original: dgod pa'i rgyud ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dgod pa'i rgyud ni 'phrul dga' ba rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
translated: The tantra of laughter is like the pleasure of the Nirmanaratis.

original: lta ba'i rgyud ni dper na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi bde ba lta @217a * //
analyzed: lta ba'i rgyud ni dper na gzhan 'phrul dbang byed pa rnams kyi bde ba lta @217a * //
translated: The tantra of looking is like the pleasure of the Paranirmitavasavartins.

original: bu'o ; / lag bcangs kyi rgyud ni dper na dga' ldan pa rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bu'o ; / lag bcangs kyi rgyud ni dper na dga' ldan pa rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
translated: The tantra of embracing is like the pleasure of the Tushitas.

original: dgod pa la sogs pa rnams la 'khyud pa'i tshul srid pa'i phyir dang 'khyud pa la yang dgod pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir 'khyud pa'i rgyud nang du 'dus shing ;
analyzed: dgod pa la sogs pa rnams la 'khyud pa'i tshul srid pa'i phyir dang 'khyud pa la yang dgod pa la sogs pa srid pa'i phyir 'khyud pa'i rgyud nang du 'dus shing ;
translated: Since the method of embracing exists in laughter, etc., and since laughter, etc., exist in embracing, the tantra of embracing is included within the tantra of laughter, etc.

original: de ni 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ni 'thab bral ba rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the pleasure of the Yamas.

original: gnyis gnyis kyi rgyud sngar gsungs zin cing dper na sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris pa rnams dang mi rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis kyi rgyud sngar gsungs zin cing dper na sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris pa rnams dang mi rnams kyi bde ba lta bu'o //
translated: The two-fold continuum has been taught previously, for example, the pleasure of the Thirty-Three gods, the pleasure of the gods of the Four Great Kings, and the pleasure of humans.

original: de ltar yang de dang de'i bde ba rnams dag pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba kho na chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang chen po'i bdag nyid dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad dga' dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni thabs kyi
analyzed: de ltar yang de dang de'i bde ba rnams dag pas lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba kho na chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang chen po'i bdag nyid dga' ba dang mchog dga' dang khyad dga' dang lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin ni thabs kyi
translated: Thus, the innate joy itself, which is small, middling, great, and greater, is the nature of joy, supreme joy, special joy, and innate joy.

original: rgyud de byang chub kyi sems kho na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par bstan to //
analyzed: rgyud de byang chub kyi sems kho na rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par bstan to //
translated: The method continuum is taught to be the bodhicitta itself, which is naturally pure.

original: 'on kyang 'gyur ba nyid kyis na chags pa ste khyad dga'i mthar thug pas dang chags bral gyis te bde ba rnam par chad pas nye bar bcom pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gyur ba nyid kyis na chags pa ste khyad dga'i mthar thug pas dang chags bral gyis te bde ba rnam par chad pas nye bar bcom pa'o //
translated: However, it is destroyed by change, that is, by supreme joy, which is the end of attachment, and by the absence of attachment, which is the cessation of pleasure.

original: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni bstan pa za bar mtshungs pa'i phyir shing srin te shing srin 'dra ba ni shing srin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rgyud ni bstan pa za bar mtshungs pa'i phyir shing srin te shing srin 'dra ba ni shing srin te /
translated: The result continuum is like a tree worm, because it is similar to eating the teaching.

original: de ni chags pa dang chags bral dag zos nas mi 'gyur ba srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par gnas so //
analyzed: de ni chags pa dang chags bral dag zos nas mi 'gyur ba srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mi gnas par gnas so //
translated: Having eaten attachment and non-attachment, it abides without change, not abiding in existence or nirvana.

original: ghu na dang ghu rna ni 'khyam pa la'o //
analyzed: ghu na dang ghu rna ni 'khyam pa la'o //
translated: Ghuṇa and ghurṇa are for wandering.

original: 'khyam par byed cing mi gnas te 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes pa ghu na'o //
analyzed: 'khyam par byed cing mi gnas te 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams la'o zhes pa ghu na'o //
translated: It wanders, not abiding, in attachment and so on, thus it is ghuṇa.

original: de kho na bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams thams cad yang dag par te sgrib pa med par bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis kun nas sbyor bas mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom /
analyzed: de kho na bcom ldan 'das rnal 'byor ma'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams thams cad yang dag par te sgrib pa med par bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis kun nas sbyor bas mkha' 'gro ma'i dra ba sdom /
translated: That very Blessed One, the nature of Yoginī, by completely, that is, unobstructedly, uniting all the channels with the single taste of great bliss, binds the web of dakinis.

original: don gzhan yang gsungs par bshad do zhes pa'o //🔽dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: don gzhan yang gsungs par bshad do zhes pa'o // dpal yang dag par sbyor ba'i rgyud kyi rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: It is explained that another meaning is also stated.🔽The twenty-third flower in the Bouquet of Instructions,

original: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: man ngag gi snye mar snye ma nyi shu gsum pa'o /
translated: the commentary on the glorious Heruka's Tantra.

original: // / chos kyi sku la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba gzhan slar yang bstan pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rgyas par bya ba'i ched du dri ba la gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / chos kyi sku la sogs pa rnams kyi dbye ba gzhan slar yang bstan pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa kho na rgyas par bya ba'i ched du dri ba la gzhug pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: Another classification of the dharmakāya, etc., is taught in order to introduce the question for the sake of elaborating just the completion stage.

original: de nas zhes @217b pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes @217b pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo ni dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The wheel is the maṇḍala.

original: lha ni he ru ka la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha ni he ru ka la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The deities are the Herukas, etc.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams ni bdag med ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The ḍākinīs are Nairātmyā, etc.

original: dgongs pas te mngon par dgongs pas gang gsungs pa ni dgongs pa'i skad de /
analyzed: dgongs pas te mngon par dgongs pas gang gsungs pa ni dgongs pa'i skad de /
translated: That which is taught with an intention, with a thought, is the intentional speech.

original: ldem por dgongs pa gtso bor gsungs kyi yi ge gtso bo ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa gtso bor gsungs kyi yi ge gtso bo ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The indirect intention is primary, not the syllables.

original: rnal 'byor ma'i ste bdag med ma'i sdom pa zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma'i ste bdag med ma'i sdom pa zhes 'brel lo //
translated: The yoginī’s, i.e., Nairātmya’s, vow is connected.

original: lus dbus ni lte ba'o //
analyzed: lus dbus ni lte ba'o //
translated: The body’s center is the navel.

original: aa yig ces pa dbyangs dang po'o //
analyzed: aa yig ces pa dbyangs dang po'o //
translated: The letter A is the first vowel.

original: ci ltar aa yig sdom pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar aa yig sdom pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is the letter A the vow? It is said:

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: As, etc.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gsal bar nyams su myong ba de ltar nang yang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gsal bar nyams su myong ba de ltar nang yang ste /
translated: Just as the external is experienced as clear, so also the internal.

original: kun rdzob pa de yang yod do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun rdzob pa de yang yod do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And that conventional reality also exists. This is the meaning of the statement.

original: phyi rol dang nang gi kun rdzob aa yig la ci zhig yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi kun rdzob aa yig la ci zhig yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is the external and internal conventional reality in the letter A?

original: bo la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bo la zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is stated:🔽The bliss born from the full moon,

original: gang po la las skyes pa'i bde ba phyag rgya chen po kha na aa yig gi ngo bo can ni de'i zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang po la las skyes pa'i bde ba phyag rgya chen po kha na aa yig gi ngo bo can ni de'i zhes pa'i don to //
translated: the great seal, the nature of the letter A, is that.

original: 'o na bde ba chen po 'di shes rab 'ba' zhig gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bde ba chen po 'di shes rab 'ba' zhig gis 'gyur ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Now, if it is asked whether this great bliss is not just from wisdom alone,🔽it is stated:

original: gsungs pa / rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rdo rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra,

original: rdo rje rnams kyi ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi skye mched gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor 'lor gnas ba'i ham yig dang ri bong can rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ngo bo de ni 'dir thabs so //
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyi ste de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi skye mched gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor 'lor gnas ba'i ham yig dang ri bong can rdo rje 'dzin pa'i ngo bo de ni 'dir thabs so //
translated: the sense bases of the vajra ones, the tathāgatas, abiding in the place of great bliss, the syllable haṃ, and the rabbit, the nature of Vajradhara, is the method here.

original: de ni 'di la brten nas yang dag par sbyor ro zhes pas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo phyag rgya chen por brjod do //
analyzed: de ni 'di la brten nas yang dag par sbyor ro zhes pas bde ba chen po'i ngo bo phyag rgya chen por brjod do //
translated: That is expressed as the great seal, the nature of great bliss, by based on this, one is perfectly joined.

original: gsang bdag gi ste aa dang ham yig dag gi snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: gsang bdag gi ste aa dang ham yig dag gi snyoms par zhugs pa ste /
translated: The union of the lord of secrets, the letters A and HAM,

original: ro mnyam par gyur pas so //
analyzed: ro mnyam par gyur pas so //
translated: is the equality of taste.

original: phyi rol gnyis sprod ni las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gnyis sprod ni las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The external union is the nature of the union with the karma seal.

original: des bstan pa ni dper byas pa'o //
analyzed: des bstan pa ni dper byas pa'o //
translated: That is illustrated by taught by that.

original: de'i 'di sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'di sdom pa'o //
translated: This is the summary of that.

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs dag gi sdom pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs dag gi sdom pa gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, having stated the vows of wisdom and means,

original: sku gsum gyi sdom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sku gsum gyi sdom pa gsungs pa /
translated: he states the vows of the three bodies.

original: sku gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three bodies, etc.

original: gal te sku gsum 'khor lo'i gzugs kyis sdom pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te sku gsum 'khor lo'i gzugs kyis sdom pa yin na /
translated: If the vow is the form of the wheel of the three bodies,🔽 then what is the nature of the fourth wheel?

original: 'o na 'khor lo bzhi pa ci'i ngo bor 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa sku gsum yongs su shes pa'i ngo bo bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo sku gsum sdud pa'i rnam pa can bzhi pa 'di ni 'dir lhan @218a * //
analyzed: 'o na 'khor lo bzhi pa ci'i ngo bor 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa sku gsum yongs su shes pa'i ngo bo bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo sku gsum sdud pa'i rnam pa can bzhi pa 'di ni 'dir lhan @218a * //
translated: The fourth wheel, the nature of the complete knowledge of the three bodies, the nature of great bliss, having the aspect of the collection of the three bodies, is here the vajra body, etc.

original: cig skyes pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: cig skyes pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i bar ro //
translated: The body of birth.

original: 'khor lo rnams kyi ming rnams gsungs pa chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams kyi ming rnams gsungs pa chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The names of the wheels are stated by “Dharma” and so forth.

original: ji ltar rigs par 'di rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par 'di rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa /
translated: The locations of these are stated as appropriate:

original: skye gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skye gnas zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The place of birth” and so forth.

original: so sor dang tshogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: so sor dang tshogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Individually and collectively.

original: skye gnas ni 'dir bud med dang skyes pa dag gi lte ba'i 'og gi gnas so //
analyzed: skye gnas ni 'dir bud med dang skyes pa dag gi lte ba'i 'og gi gnas so //
translated: The place of birth is here the place below the navel of women and men.

original: gsum ni bzhi pa dang lhan cig go zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gsum ni bzhi pa dang lhan cig go zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The three are together with the fourth.🔽Even so, one does not know what is what.

original: de lta na yang ci zhig tu ci zhig sdom pa mi shes so zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang ci zhig tu ci zhig sdom pa mi shes so zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: ma lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ma lus zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The totality” and so forth.

original: rang tu brjod ces pa rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: rang tu brjod ces pa rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: “Well known” is well known.

original: skye gnas kyi 'khor lor sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: skye gnas kyi 'khor lor sprul pa'i sku'o zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that the emanation body is in the place of birth wheel.

original: 'o na ji ltar dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi rgyun skye gnas su skye ba de ltar ci sprul pa yang yin nam zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi rgyun skye gnas su skye ba de ltar ci sprul pa yang yin nam zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well then, just as the continuum of sentient beings is born in the place of birth, is the emanation body also like that? It is said:

original: sprul pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Emanation is the means of accomplishing the aims of beings.

original: sprul pa yang dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: sprul pa yang dpag tu med pa'i sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: Emanation is the means of accomplishing the aims of beings, since it is immeasurable.

original: gang gi phyir dpag tu med pa brgyud pa'i ngo bor brtan pa ste gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir de yang 'dir bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpag tu med pa brgyud pa'i ngo bor brtan pa ste gnas pa yin pa de'i phyir de yang 'dir bskyed par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since it is immeasurable, it is firm, i.e. stable, in the form of a continuum. Therefore, it is to be generated here. This is the meaning.

original: skye ba yongs su dag pa kho na ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: skye ba yongs su dag pa kho na ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: The pure state of birth is the emanation body of the buddhas.

original: ci ltar skye gnas brtan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar skye gnas brtan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it firm in the sense of birth?

original: zur gsum nyid kyis nas gzhi dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zur gsum nyid kyis nas gzhi dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is similar to a basis, i.e. a foundation, in three ways.

original: gang gi phyir yang skye gnas kyi 'khor lor sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ba de'i phyir de kho na sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bor sdom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang skye gnas kyi 'khor lor sprul pa'i skur 'gyur ba de'i phyir de kho na sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bor sdom pa'o //
translated: Since the wheel of birth is the emanation body, it is summarized as having the nature of the emanation body.

original: sprul pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis nye ba'i phyir skye gnas kyis ni sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas bskyed cing /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sgrub par byed pa nyid kyis nye ba'i phyir skye gnas kyis ni sprul pa'i sku'i sangs rgyas bskyed cing /
translated: The emanation body generates the buddhas, since it is the means of accomplishing emanation.

original: skye gnas las skyes pa yang sems can rnams so //
analyzed: skye gnas las skyes pa yang sems can rnams so //
translated: And beings are born from the emanation body.

original: chos shes pa rang bzhin med pa nyid sems kyi rang bzhin ngo bo sems las tha mi dad pa'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa rang bzhin med pa nyid sems kyi rang bzhin ngo bo sems las tha mi dad pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of phenomena is the nature of mind, the essence of mind, not different from mind.

original: de'i phyir sems kyang chos so //🔽de'i phyir chos nyid kyi sku'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyang chos so // de'i phyir chos nyid kyi sku'am /
translated: Therefore, mind is phenomena.🔽Therefore, the dharmakāya is the body of phenomena,

original: chos sems kyi khyad par rnams kyi sku chos kyi sku ni snying gar 'gyur ro zhes pa /
analyzed: chos sems kyi khyad par rnams kyi sku chos kyi sku ni snying gar 'gyur ro zhes pa /
translated: or the body of the phenomena of the mind.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo snying gar 'gyur te sems ni gtso bor snying ga kho nar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo snying gar 'gyur te sems ni gtso bor snying ga kho nar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel of phenomena is in the heart, because the mind is located in the heart.🔽How is the nature of mind phenomena?

original: ci ltar na sems kyi rang gi ngo bo chos yin zhe na gsungs pa /🔽thams cad @218b ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar na sems kyi rang gi ngo bo chos yin zhe na gsungs pa / thams cad @218b ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad brtan pa nyid de gcig dang du ma nyid dang 'bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams thams cad brtan pa nyid de gcig dang du ma nyid dang 'bral ba la sogs pa'i tshad mas nges pa nyid do //
translated: All phenomena, such as the aggregates, are ascertained by valid cognition to be stable, free from one and many, and so on.

original: de'i phyir gang cung zad yod pa'i rang bzhin yod bzhin ba'i dngos po skyes pa de thams cad ni chos kho na yin zhing rang bzhin med pa nyid dang tha mi dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang cung zad yod pa'i rang bzhin yod bzhin ba'i dngos po skyes pa de thams cad ni chos kho na yin zhing rang bzhin med pa nyid dang tha mi dad pa kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, whatever is existent, having a nature that exists, and is produced, all of that is just phenomena, and is not different from essencelessness.

original: sems kyang de ltar chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyang de ltar chos thams cad kyi nang du gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because mind is included among all phenomena, it is just like that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i de ma thag tu /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i de ma thag tu /
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it should be understood:

original: chos rnams kun la brtan nyid phyir //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la brtan nyid phyir //
translated: Because of the stability of all phenomena,

original: thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin can //🔽zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod pa'i rang bzhin can // zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: all have the nature of existence.

original: po ti'i mkhas pa gsal ba'i don du chod pas gsungs pa'am /
analyzed: po ti'i mkhas pa gsal ba'i don du chod pas gsungs pa'am /
translated: This is stated for the sake of clarifying the meaning for the scholars of Bodhgaya,

original: glegs bam kha cig tu 'di lhung ba ni dgongs par dka' ba'i bya rog gi rkang pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: glegs bam kha cig tu 'di lhung ba ni dgongs par dka' ba'i bya rog gi rkang pa can nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: or because it is difficult to understand the intention of those who have fallen into some texts, which have the feet of a crow.

original: ro'i ngo bo can rnams kyi zhes pa ro drug gi ngo bo can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ro'i ngo bo can rnams kyi zhes pa ro drug gi ngo bo can rnams kyi'o //
translated: The meaning of “having the nature of taste” is having the nature of the six tastes.

original: longs spyod pa ni nye bar spyod pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod pa ni nye bar spyod pa ste /
translated: Enjoyment is enjoyment.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: It is the enjoyment body.

original: de'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo mgrin par ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir longs spyod rdzogs pa'i 'khor lo mgrin par ro //
translated: Therefore, the enjoyment wheel is in the throat.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni gsung rdo rje ni ston par byed pa gtso bos longs spyod rdzogs par gsungs shing /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni gsung rdo rje ni ston par byed pa gtso bos longs spyod rdzogs par gsungs shing /
translated: In the Perfection Vehicle system, the teacher Vajradhara is said to be the enjoyment body,

original: ro nye bar longs spyod pa gtso bo ma yin par byas so //
analyzed: ro nye bar longs spyod pa gtso bo ma yin par byas so //
translated: and the enjoyment of taste is not primary.

original: 'dir ni bzlog pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir ni bzlog pa nyid kyis so //
translated: But here it is the opposite.🔽In the Perfection Vehicle system, those who have attained the ten grounds are said to be the enjoyment body,

original: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni sa bcu brnyes pa rnams la zab mo'i chos bstan pas chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i yan lag nyid kyis ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la ni sa bcu brnyes pa rnams la zab mo'i chos bstan pas chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'i yan lag nyid kyis ni /
translated: because they have the aspect of perfect enjoyment of the Dharma through teaching the profound Dharma.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu'i bdag nyid kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nar brjod cing /
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad brgyad cu'i bdag nyid kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku kho nar brjod cing /
translated: They are said to be the enjoyment body, which has the form of the thirty-two major and eighty minor marks.

original: 'dir ni 'dir chos kyi sku'i dbang gis gdul bya'i ngor bde mchog dang 'dus pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis de ltar sprul pas so sor snang ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sku yang ngo //🔽gang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas sprul pa'i skur pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'dir chos kyi sku'i dbang gis gdul bya'i ngor bde mchog dang 'dus pa dang kye'i rdo rje la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis de ltar sprul pas so sor snang ba'i phyir sprul pa'i sku yang ngo // gang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas sprul pa'i skur pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la gsungs pa de ni /
translated: Here, however, the emanation body is the appearance of the body of the Buddha in the form of Heruka, Guhyasamaja, Hevajra, and so on, by the power of the Dharma body, in the presence of those to be trained.

original: 'dir yang de dang 'dra ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang de dang 'dra ba kho na ste /
translated: The emanation body of the Buddha, which is taught in the Perfection Vehicle, is the same here.

original: sprul pa'i sprul pa bzhin yang ngo //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sprul pa bzhin yang ngo //
translated: It is like an emanation of an emanation.

original: chos kyi skus sprul pa nyid yin na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la tha dad pa nyid de /🔽chos la rdzogs par @219a * //
analyzed: chos kyi skus sprul pa nyid yin na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la tha dad pa nyid de / chos la rdzogs par @219a * //
translated: Even though it is an emanation of the Dharma body, the enjoyment body is different in the Perfection Vehicle.

original: longs spyod pa kho na las so //
analyzed: longs spyod pa kho na las so //
translated: It is the enjoyment of the Dharma alone.

original: 'dir ni ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ngag gi ngo bo nyid kyis kyang ste /
translated: Here, it is also the enjoyment of speech.

original: ro la longs spyod pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: ro la longs spyod pa las kyang ngo //
translated: It is also the enjoyment of taste.

original: spyi bor gnas zhes pa spyi bo kho na zla ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: spyi bor gnas zhes pa spyi bo kho na zla ba'i gnas nyid kyi phyir /
translated: The line “it abides in the head” means that the head is the abode of the moon.

original: bde ba chen po ni gtso cher gtso bo'i gnas kho nar gnas so zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: bde ba chen po ni gtso cher gtso bo'i gnas kho nar gnas so zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: Great bliss abides in the principal place, which is the principal abode.

original: /'bras bu rnams kyang 'dir 'khor lo bzhir sdom pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: /'bras bu rnams kyang 'dir 'khor lo bzhir sdom pa gsungs pa /
translated: The results are also taught here as being included in the four cakras.

original: ae bam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ae bam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The letter e and vam, etc.

original: ae bam yi ge ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: ae bam yi ge ni sprul pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: The letter e is the emanation cakra,

original: shes rab dang thabs ro gcig pa dag gi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs ro gcig pa dag gi rten nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the support of the single taste of wisdom and method.

original: rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa 'di yang ci zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa la sogs pa 'di yang ci zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What is this natural outflow, etc.?

original: 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result, etc.

original: bye brag las te khyad par las so //
analyzed: bye brag las te khyad par las so //
translated: From the particular, from the distinction.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu zhes pa la sogs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The result of natural outflow, etc.

original: de la gang ji ltar byas pa de de ltar nye bar longs spyod pa de rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /🔽'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'o ;
analyzed: de la gang ji ltar byas pa de de ltar nye bar longs spyod pa de rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste / 'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa'o ;
translated: There, whatever is done, that is enjoyed in that way. That is the result of natural outflow.🔽The arising of something similar is natural outflow.

original: / rgyu mthun dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: / rgyu mthun dang 'dra ba'o zhes pa ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: The definition is “natural outflow is similar to the cause.”

original: khyad par du smin cing smin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang de kho na 'bras bu ste /🔽'dra ba las lhag pa ste las chung ngu la yang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par du smin cing smin pa ni rnam par smin pa dang de kho na 'bras bu ste / 'dra ba las lhag pa ste las chung ngu la yang ngo //
translated: The special result is the result of natural outcome and the result of conscious effort.🔽The result of conscious effort is superior to the cause, and the result of natural outcome is similar to the cause.

original: gang skyes bu ste skyes bu'i byed pas nye bar bsgrub pa de skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: gang skyes bu ste skyes bu'i byed pas nye bar bsgrub pa de skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of conscious effort is the result of an action that is accomplished by the effort of a person.

original: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor rnam par dag pa las sgrib pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dri ma dang bral ba las dri ma med pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang thabs kyi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor rnam par dag pa las sgrib pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can gyi dri ma dang bral ba las dri ma med pa'i 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: The stainless result is the result of the purification of yoga, which is the nature of wisdom and method, and is free from the stains that are characterized by the two obscurations.

original: de ci 'bras bu 'di gnyis las la mi ltos pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'bras bu 'di gnyis las la mi ltos pa kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are these two results not dependent on action?

original: de ltar ma yin te snga ma'i 'bras bu gnyis la skyes bu'i byed pa la mi ltos pa nyid kyi phyir las 'bras bu kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te snga ma'i 'bras bu gnyis la skyes bu'i byed pa la mi ltos pa nyid kyi phyir las 'bras bu kho na'o //
translated: No, they are not. The former two results are only the results of action, because they are not dependent on the effort of a person.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu la ni las gtso bo min pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu la ni las gtso bo min pa'o //
translated: In the result of conscious effort, action is not the primary factor.

original: dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu ni las dang skyes bu'i byed pa gnyis ka dag mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu ni las dang skyes bu'i byed pa gnyis ka dag mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The stainless result is the purity of both the action and the person.

original: 'o na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu 'di 'jig rten la med cing /
analyzed: 'o na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu 'di 'jig rten la med cing /
translated: But this stainless result does not exist in the world.

original: 'jig rten la med pa yang ci ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa la 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten la med pa yang ci ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa la 'gyur te /
translated: And how can what does not exist in the world be supramundane?

original: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no seed.

original: 'di ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: 'jig rten la yang ji ltar rigs par lus dang ngag dang yid dri ma med par @219b byed pa nges par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la yang ji ltar rigs par lus dang ngag dang yid dri ma med par @219b byed pa nges par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a stainless action of body, speech, and mind in the world, as is appropriate.🔽And it is said in the second chapter:

original: gang / dri med rnal 'byor dag pa las //
analyzed: gang / dri med rnal 'byor dag pa las //
translated: “From the stainless, pure yoga.

original: zhes brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa de ni mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: zhes brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa de ni mthar thug pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: ” That is from the ultimate point of view.🔽Then, these four results are purified in the four wheels in order.

original: de nas 'bras bu bzhi po 'di yang 'khor lo bzhi la rim pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes pas de la sdom par brjod do //
analyzed: de nas 'bras bu bzhi po 'di yang 'khor lo bzhi la rim pas rnam par dag par 'gyur ro zhes pas de la sdom par brjod do //
translated: This is stated in the summary verse.

original: ci zhig gis 'bras bu 'di nye bar spyod ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci zhig gis 'bras bu 'di nye bar spyod ce na gsungs pa /
translated: By what is this result experienced? It is said:

original: las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Action, etc.”

original: 'bras bu rnams las kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams las kyis byas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because the results are produced by karma,

original: de rnams nye bar spyad pa na las kho na nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro zhes pas las la spyod ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de rnams nye bar spyad pa na las kho na nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro zhes pas las la spyod ces gsungs so //
translated: when they are experienced, it is only karma that is experienced. Thus, it is said that one experiences karma.

original: bdag med pa'i phyir shes rab ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir shes rab ces gsungs so //
translated: Because there is no self, it is said to be wisdom.

original: ci ltar las la spyod pa shes rab tu 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci ltar las la spyod pa shes rab tu 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How does experiencing karma become wisdom? It is said:

original: las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽dbang phyug la sogs pas bskul ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: las zhes pa la sogs pa'o // dbang phyug la sogs pas bskul ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Karma, etc.🔽It is not impelled by Īśvara, etc.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes mngon par dgongs so //
translated: because Īśvara, etc. do not exist.

original: las kho na rlung 'thor byed de /
analyzed: las kho na rlung 'thor byed de /
translated: Karma alone scatters the winds.

original: des bskul ba ni bskyod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des bskul ba ni bskyod par gyur pa'o //
translated: Impelled by that, it becomes agitated.

original: las kyis bskyed pa yang rlung ngo //
analyzed: las kyis bskyed pa yang rlung ngo //
translated: The winds are generated by karma.

original: rnam pa thams cad du las kho na bskul ba po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du las kho na bskul ba po ste /
translated: In every way, karma alone is the impeller,

original: rlung de yang des byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung de yang des byas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the winds are also produced by it.

original: yang na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag de ltar bstan pa dag go //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag de ltar bstan pa dag go //
translated: Or, the seen and unseen are taught in that way.

original: de ltar ni las la spyod ces pa 'dis ni ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni las la spyod ces pa 'dis ni ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Thus, “acts” refers to the unseen,

original: las kyi rlung zhes pa 'dis ni mthong ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi rlung zhes pa 'dis ni mthong ba'o //
translated: and “karmavāyu” refers to the seen.

original: de ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tshogs pa las byung ba ni 'bras bu'o zhes pa'i grub mtha' rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba dang ma mthong ba tshogs pa las byung ba ni 'bras bu'o zhes pa'i grub mtha' rjes su mthun par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the conclusion is that the result arises from the combination of the seen and unseen.

original: las kyi rlung 'di de yang lte ba'i 'og tu gnas te /
analyzed: las kyi rlung 'di de yang lte ba'i 'og tu gnas te /
translated: This karmavāyu is located below the navel.

original: de skad du yang sngar gsungs pa /🔽sum mdo'i phyogs su gnas pa yi //
analyzed: de skad du yang sngar gsungs pa / sum mdo'i phyogs su gnas pa yi //
translated: Thus, it was previously stated:

original: las kyis byas pa las kyi rlung //
analyzed: las kyis byas pa las kyi rlung //
translated: The karmavāyu, created by karma,🔽resides in the place of the triple junction.🔽And:🔽The maṇḍala of the navel blazes

original: zhes dang / las kyi rlung gis bskyod byas pa //🔽lte ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'bar ro //
analyzed: zhes dang / las kyi rlung gis bskyod byas pa // lte ba'i dkyil 'khor du 'bar ro //
translated: through being moved by the karmavāyu.

original: zhes so // 'khor lo bzhi po de nyid la sde ba rnams sdom pa gsungs pa /🔽gnas brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // 'khor lo bzhi po de nyid la sde ba rnams sdom pa gsungs pa / gnas brtan pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four cakras are said to be the four divisions.🔽The Sthaviras are the assembly of bhikṣus,

original: brtan pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas brtan pas dge slong gi tshogs so //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir gnas brtan pas dge slong gi tshogs so //
translated: because they possess stability.

original: de la ni rgyun gyis 'jug pas brtan par dngos po rnams brjod par bya'o //🔽sprul @220a * //
analyzed: de la ni rgyun gyis 'jug pas brtan par dngos po rnams brjod par bya'o // sprul @220a * //
translated: In that, things should be expressed as stable by the engagement of the continuum.

original: pa yang brtan pa kho na ste /
analyzed: pa yang brtan pa kho na ste /
translated: Even emanations are stable.

original: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas so zhes pas sprul pa'i 'khor lo la de sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pas so zhes pas sprul pa'i 'khor lo la de sdom pa'o //
translated: By the reasoning explained previously, that is, the emanation wheel is bound by that.

original: thams cad yod do zhes gang du smra ba de ni thams cad yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad yod do zhes gang du smra ba de ni thams cad yod par smra ba ste /
translated: Where it is said, “Everything exists,” that is the Proponents of Everything Existing.

original: de la ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gi chos rnams kyang yang dag par yod pa'i zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de la ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gi chos rnams kyang yang dag par yod pa'i zhes brjod do //
translated: In that, it is said that the phenomena of the past and future times are also real.

original: de ji ltar chos kyi 'khor lor yin zhe na /🔽chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar chos kyi 'khor lor yin zhe na / chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: How is that in the wheel of dharma?

original: chos te sems ni thams cad yod ces pa'i ngag gi 'byung byed de rgyu'o //
analyzed: chos te sems ni thams cad yod ces pa'i ngag gi 'byung byed de rgyu'o //
translated: Dharma means the mind. Everything exists is the speech. The cause is the origin.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa nyid kyis gzhag pa kho na chos rnams kyis 'di ltar gyur pa smra ba'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa nyid kyis gzhag pa kho na chos rnams kyis 'di ltar gyur pa smra ba'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phenomena are only posited by the past and so on. This is the way things are. The Proponents of Everything Existing speak in this way.

original: nyams su myong ba yod do zhes pas nyams myong can te lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yod do zhes pas nyams myong can te lung nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The experiencer exists. Because of the scriptures, the experiencer exists.

original: de la ni nyams su myong ba'i rten gang zag brjod do //
analyzed: de la ni nyams su myong ba'i rten gang zag brjod do //
translated: The person who is the basis of experience is described.🔽How is it summarized in the enjoyment wheel?

original: de ji ltar longs spyod kyi 'khor lor sdom zhe na gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ji ltar longs spyod kyi 'khor lor sdom zhe na gsungs pa //
translated: It is said:

original: mgrin par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In the throat, etc.”

original: dge 'dun phal chen pa ni sde pa'i thu bo ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun phal chen pa ni sde pa'i thu bo ste /
translated: The Mahāsāṃghika is the head of the schools.

original: de ji ltar bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la sdom zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ji ltar bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo la sdom zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it summarized in the great bliss wheel? It is said:

original: sde chen pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sde chen pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The Mahāsāṃghika, etc.”

original: gang gi phyir spyi bor gnas pa de'i phyir 'di bde ba chen po kho nar sdom pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi bor gnas pa de'i phyir 'di bde ba chen po kho nar sdom pa'o //
translated: Because it abides in the head, it is summarized only in great bliss.

original: de thu bo nyid kyis na mchog gi gnas su dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thu bo nyid kyis na mchog gi gnas su dbang du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being the head, it is the supreme place of control.

original: ma'i lto ba gtsug lag khang ngo //
analyzed: ma'i lto ba gtsug lag khang ngo //
translated: The womb is the monastery.

original: de'i skye gnas kho nar 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de'i skye gnas kho nar 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: In that very womb, there is freedom from attachment.

original: skye ba len pa'i dus su lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba thob pas so //
analyzed: skye ba len pa'i dus su lhan cig skyes pa nyams su myong ba thob pas so //
translated: At the time of taking birth, the experience of the connate is obtained.

original: mngal gyi phru ma 'bar te rab tu 'bar ba 'dri ma can ni chos gos so //
analyzed: mngal gyi phru ma 'bar te rab tu 'bar ba 'dri ma can ni chos gos so //
translated: The embryo in the womb, blazing and very hot, is the dirty robe.

original: spyi bor thal mo sbyar ba ni spyi bor thal mo sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: spyi bor thal mo sbyar ba ni spyi bor thal mo sbyar ba ste /
translated: The palms joined above the head means the palms joined above the head.

original: de lta kho nar mngal du gnas pa'i phyir dang phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta kho nar mngal du gnas pa'i phyir dang phyir 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the one who is in the womb and the one who is born are just like that.

original: 'gro ba'i bya ba zhes pa 'gro ba'i don lhur len pa kho na der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bya ba zhes pa 'gro ba'i don lhur len pa kho na der gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The activity of going means the one who is intent on the meaning of going is just like that, abiding there.

original: de bzhin zhes pa /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa /
translated: Just like that means

original: de lta aa ham zhes pa sngags kyi bzlas pa ste /
analyzed: de lta aa ham zhes pa sngags kyi bzlas pa ste /
translated: just like that, aham, the mantra recitation.

original: ji ltar aa yig dang ham yig lte ba dang mgo bo dag la ltar ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ji ltar aa yig dang ham yig lte ba dang mgo bo dag la ltar ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Just as the letter a and the letter ham are in the navel and the head, respectively, is the remainder.

original: sna bug dag gis dbugs phyir 'byung ba yang skye gnas las phyi rol du byung ba kho na yi ste mngal du ni ma yin no zhes gsung ngo //
analyzed: sna bug dag gis dbugs phyir 'byung ba yang skye gnas las phyi rol du byung ba kho na yi ste mngal du ni ma yin no zhes gsung ngo //
translated: The exhalation of breath through the nostrils is only the one who has come out from the womb, not the one in the womb, he says.

original: sngags ni 'di gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: sngags ni 'di gnyis kho na ste /
translated: These two are the mantras

original: ngag gi @220b bzlas pa dang rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: ngag gi @220b bzlas pa dang rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: which have the character of the recitation of speech and the recitation of the vajra.

original: gcer bu ni 'dom dkris med pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bu ni 'dom dkris med pa'o //
translated: Naked means without a loincloth.

original: 'o na de lta bu yin na yang ji ltar sems can rnams sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta bu yin na yang ji ltar sems can rnams sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: But if it is like that, then how are sentient beings buddhas?

original: sa rnams ma thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sa rnams ma thob pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because they have not attained the stages.🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / sa rnams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / sa rnams zhes pa'o //
translated: The stages.

original: sa bcu yongs su dag pas ni zla ba bcu rnams sa bcu rnams so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bcu yongs su dag pas ni zla ba bcu rnams sa bcu rnams so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The ten pure stages are the ten stages.

original: bde ba'i sa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi zla ba rnams yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'di brjod par bya'o / ji ltar sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltar de'i sa thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i sa la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi zla ba rnams yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'di brjod par bya'o / ji ltar sa bcu'i dbang phyug byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltar de'i sa thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This should be stated because the moons of those who have entered the stage of bliss are completely pure. Just as for the bodhisattvas who are lords of the ten stages, but they have not attained that stage.

original: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag tu bcas pa'i 'khor lo bzhi yongs su rdzogs pas ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
analyzed: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag tu bcas pa'i 'khor lo bzhi yongs su rdzogs pas ni sangs rgyas nyid de /
translated: Buddhahood is the complete perfection of the four wheels along with their branches and sub-branches.

original: de yang dpag tu med pa'i zla ba rnams kho nas so //
analyzed: de yang dpag tu med pa'i zla ba rnams kho nas so //
translated: And that is attained only by immeasurable moons.

original: spros pa ni man ngag ji lta bar rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: spros pa ni man ngag ji lta bar rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Elaboration should be completed according to the instructions.

original: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ces pa skye ba'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang phyug ces pa skye ba'i dus su'o //
translated: The lord of the ten stages is at the time of birth.

original: de las gong du brtan pa dang g-yo ba rtogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gong du brtan pa dang g-yo ba rtogs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams so zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intention is: The buddhas are the ones who realize the stability and movement beyond that.🔽If that is so, then the form of the deity in meditative equipoise, which is the nature of the bliss of the distinctions of joy, etc.,

original: gal te de lta na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa snga tshogs pa'i rnam pa bud med dang skyes pa'i bdag nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i lha'i ngo bo dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa skyes pa dang 'chi ba dang skyes ba dang
analyzed: gal te de lta na sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa snga tshogs pa'i rnam pa bud med dang skyes pa'i bdag nyid snyoms par 'jug pa'i lha'i ngo bo dga' ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa skyes pa dang 'chi ba dang skyes ba dang
translated: which is the nature of the deity of the male and female nature, which is the form of the prior collection of blue, yellow, etc.,

original: 'gog pa'i ngo bo'i spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa po rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo can mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ngo
analyzed: 'gog pa'i ngo bo'i spro ba dang sdud pa'i byed pa po rdo rje sems dpa'i ngo bo dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo can mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor gyi ngo
translated: which is the nature of the mandala circle, which is the nature of great bliss, which is the nature of emptiness, which is the nature of nirvana, which is the nature of the yoga of the completion stage,

original: bo ni sgom pa med par yang yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: bo ni sgom pa med par yang yod pa kho na ste /
translated: exists without meditation.

original: 'di las pha rol bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: 'di las pha rol bsgrub par bya ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing whatsoever to be accomplished beyond this.

original: des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pas ci bya na /
analyzed: des na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pas ci bya na /
translated: Therefore, what is the use of meditating on the mandala circle of the completion stage?🔽

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta ci smos te /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta ci smos te /
translated: Therefore, what need is there to mention the mandala circle of the creation stage, since even the mandala circle of the completion stage is useless.

original: de skad du yang brtag pa gyis par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang brtag pa gyis par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, the Compendium of Practice says:

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ;
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor 'di ;
translated: What is the use of this yoga of the completion stage,

original: / bde pa dam pa bde chen 'dod //
analyzed: / bde pa dam pa bde chen 'dod //
translated: which is the highest bliss, the bliss of great exaltation?

original: rdzogs pa sgom pa med pa ste //
analyzed: rdzogs pa sgom pa med pa ste //
translated: There is no meditation on the completion stage,

original: bskyed pa yis ni dgos pa ci //
analyzed: bskyed pa yis ni dgos pa ci //
translated: so what is the use of the creation stage?

original: zhes dang / dgongs pa bla na med par yang //
analyzed: zhes dang / dgongs pa bla na med par yang //
translated: And the Unsurpassed Intention also says:

original: a'a: goms sbyor bas ci bya ste //🔽gdod nas grub pa'i rang bzhin can //
