analyzed: a'a: goms sbyor bas ci bya ste // gdod nas grub pa'i rang bzhin can //
translated: What is the use of the union of the a?🔽It is primordially existent by nature.

original: rang bzhin kho nas de grub na //🔽de bzhin @221a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin kho nas de grub na // de bzhin @221a * //
translated: If it is established by nature,

original: nyid ni rtog skyes min //🔽zhes so zhe na /
analyzed: nyid ni rtog skyes min // zhes so zhe na /
translated: then suchness is not born from conceptualization.

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: You may say this, but it is not so.

original: gang phyir tha mal pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: gang phyir tha mal pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: Because in the ordinary state,

original: de bzhin nyid yod kyang rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yod kyang rtogs pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: even though suchness exists, realization does not exist.

original: bde ba chen po ni rtag tu rgyas pa med pa kho na'o zhes sngar dpyad zin to //
analyzed: bde ba chen po ni rtag tu rgyas pa med pa kho na'o zhes sngar dpyad zin to //
translated: Great bliss is always non-increasing, as has already been analyzed.

original: gzhan yang bde ba rang rig pa'i ngo bo ni gal te yod na rtag tu rtogs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba rang rig pa'i ngo bo ni gal te yod na rtag tu rtogs te /
translated: Moreover, if the essence of the self-awareness of bliss exists, it is always realized.

original: ma rtogs pa'i snang rung ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ma rtogs pa'i snang rung ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: The unrealized is not suitable to appear.

original: yang res 'ga' ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba lus las byung ba ni dpe nyid kyis /
analyzed: yang res 'ga' ba'i lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba lus las byung ba ni dpe nyid kyis /
translated: Moreover, the occasional co-emergent bliss that arises from the body is established by the example.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur gyi //
translated: It establishes the realization of the bliss to be established.

original: khyad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a differentiator,

original: de med kyang lus la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //🔽bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba sgrub par gyur pa ni yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs su /
analyzed: de med kyang lus la sogs pa yod pa nyid kyi phyir ro // bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba sgrub par gyur pa ni yongs su dag pa'i gnas skabs su /
translated: because even without it, the body and so forth exist.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i lus las byung ba mi 'gyur ba khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo rtogs so //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad 'bar ba'i lus las byung ba mi 'gyur ba khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i ngo bo rtogs so //
translated: The establishment of the bliss to be established is the realization of the body that arises from the blazing major and minor marks in the state of complete purity, which is the nature of the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de'i tshe na ji ltar lus med par bde ba med pa de ltar lus kyang bde ba med na med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na ji ltar lus med par bde ba med pa de ltar lus kyang bde ba med na med do //
translated: At that time, just as there is no pleasure without a body, so also there is no body without pleasure.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la bde bas khyab par 'gro ba snang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das la bde bas khyab par 'gro ba snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it appears that the world is pervaded by pleasure.

original: de skad du yang brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang brtag pa gnyis par gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the second chapter:

original: lus dngos med na gal bde //
analyzed: lus dngos med na gal bde //
translated: If there is no body, how can there be pleasure?

original: bde ba smra bar mi nus so //
analyzed: bde ba smra bar mi nus so //
translated: One cannot speak of pleasure.

original: khyab bya khyab byed tshul kyis ni //
analyzed: khyab bya khyab byed tshul kyis ni //
translated: By the method of the pervaded and the pervader,

original: bde bas 'gro ba khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bde bas 'gro ba khyab pa'o //
translated: the world is pervaded by pleasure.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po bsgrub par bya ba 'di 'grub pa'i ched du bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis myos pa ji lta ba'am rim pa ji lta bar lha bsgom pa nges par bsgrub par bya'o
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po bsgrub par bya ba 'di 'grub pa'i ched du bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag gis myos pa ji lta ba'am rim pa ji lta bar lha bsgom pa nges par bsgrub par bya'o
translated: Therefore, in order to accomplish this, which is the attainment of great bliss of one taste with emptiness, the meditation on the deity should be accomplished by the generation and completion stages, just as one is intoxicated or just as one is in a state of absorption.

original: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes rtogs par bya ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to understand this, it is said:

original: btsun mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: btsun mo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Queen” and so forth.

original: btsun mo ni shes rab ma ste /
analyzed: btsun mo ni shes rab ma ste /
translated: The queen is the wisdom woman.

original: de'i bha ga ru //
analyzed: de'i bha ga ru //
translated: In her bhaga,

original: khu ba'i ming gis zhes pa byang chub sems kyi rnam pa kho na'i sems ni de ltar rab tu gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khu ba'i ming gis zhes pa byang chub sems kyi rnam pa kho na'i sems ni de ltar rab tu gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “semen” refers to the form of bodhicitta alone, since the mind is clearly manifest in that way.

original: gang yang de ltar gyur pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang de ltar gyur pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: And that which is so is the object to be accomplished.

original: de ni khu ba'i ming can te //
analyzed: de ni khu ba'i ming can te //
translated: That is the one called “semen,”

original: bde ba kho na bde nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba kho na bde nyid do //
translated: which is bliss alone, the nature of bliss.

original: bde ste khu ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: bde ste khu ba'i ming can no //
translated: Bliss is the one called “semen.”

original: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa 'di ni re re la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa 'di ni re re la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is mutual dependence, since each is not capable by itself.

original: de'i phyir yang khu ba dang lus dag gis khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang khu ba dang lus dag gis khyab pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is pervaded by both semen and the body.

original: de'i khyab par byed pa bde ba @221b chen po yang lha'i rnal 'byor las skye'o //🔽de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba don du gnyer bas 'di lta bu kho na'i don rim pa dag gis /
analyzed: de'i khyab par byed pa bde ba @221b chen po yang lha'i rnal 'byor las skye'o // de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i bde ba don du gnyer bas 'di lta bu kho na'i don rim pa dag gis /
translated: Its pervader, great bliss, arises from divine yoga.🔽Therefore, one who seeks the object to be accomplished, bliss, should meditate on divine yoga in this way alone, by stages.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor la gdon mi za bar bsgom bar bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor la gdon mi za bar bsgom bar bya'o zhes mngon par dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de yang bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bzhin pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin kho na bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bde ba chen po dang ro gcig pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor bsgom par bya bzhin pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin kho na bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should meditate on the nature of emptiness alone, which is of the same taste as great bliss, while meditating on the deity yoga.

original: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rgyu'i rgyud bsgom pa med par 'grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'dra ba'i 'bras bu'i rgyud ni rgyu'i rgyud bsgom pa med par 'grub pa ma yin no //
translated: The continuum of the effect, which is similar to the cause, is not accomplished without meditating on the continuum of the cause.

original: rgyu'i rgyud kyang rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rgyud kyang rang bzhin med pa kho na'o //
translated: The continuum of the cause is also just essenceless.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas ni sgrib pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi ngo bo ni dngos po min te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir sangs rgyas ni sgrib pa med pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje 'bras bu'i rgyud kyi ngo bo ni dngos po min te /
translated: Because it is so, therefore the Buddha, who is the nature of unobstructed great bliss, the essence of the continuum of the effect, the mind vajra of enlightenment, is not a thing.

original: sgyu ma bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma bzhin du rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because he is essenceless, like an illusion.

original: de lta na 'o na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then he would be the nature of a nonthing.

original: de ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: That is not so at all.

original: bde ba sangs rgyas de ni phyag zhabs rnam pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa yang ngo //
analyzed: bde ba sangs rgyas de ni phyag zhabs rnam pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa yang ngo //
translated: That bliss, the Buddha, also has the form of hands and feet, etc.

original: 'o na dngos po min zhes ci las gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po min zhes ci las gsungs she na /
translated: Well, then, why is it said that it is not a thing?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa / gzugs med ces pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / gzugs med ces pa rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Formless means essenceless.

original: gzugs dang rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin zhes pa rnam grangs so //
analyzed: gzugs dang rang gi ngo bo dang rang bzhin zhes pa rnam grangs so //
translated: Form, own nature, and essence are synonyms.

original: mchog gi bde ba las /
analyzed: mchog gi bde ba las /
translated: From the Supreme Bliss:

original: mchog ni bla na med pa ste sgrib pa spangs pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mchog ni bla na med pa ste sgrib pa spangs pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: Supreme is unexcelled, the bliss of the abandonment of obscurations.

original: sgrib pa spangs pa yang stong pa nyid rtogs pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs pa yang stong pa nyid rtogs pa med par ma yin no //
translated: The abandonment of obscurations is not without the realization of emptiness.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir 'bras bu dngos po ma yin zhing dngos med kyang ma yin pa /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir 'bras bu dngos po ma yin zhing dngos med kyang ma yin pa /
translated: Thus, because the effect is neither a thing nor a non-thing,

original: de phyir 'gro kun lhan cig skyes //
analyzed: de phyir 'gro kun lhan cig skyes //
translated: Therefore, all beings are connate.

original: zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa sangs rgyas nyid dang ste gnyug ma'i de bzhin nyid dang sbyor ba'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa sangs rgyas nyid dang ste gnyug ma'i de bzhin nyid dang sbyor ba'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: Connate means buddhahood, and connate because it is connected with intrinsic suchness.

original: 'gro kun zhes pa sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'gro kun zhes pa sems can rnams so //
translated: All beings means sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas nyid lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid lhan cig skyes pa'o zhes pa'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “connate buddhahood”?🔽It is said:

original: gsungs pa lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa lhan cig skyes pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Connateness, and so on.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin te ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni rang bzhin te ;
translated: The meaning is that its own nature is its essence.

original: rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi rnam grangs lhan cig skyes pa'i sgra'o zhes pa dgongs pa'o //
translated: The term “innate” is a synonym for “nature.”

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang gtso cher chos kyi sku ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang gtso cher chos kyi sku ste /
translated: Buddhahood is primarily the dharmakāya.

original: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: With that in mind, it is said:

original: rang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Its own nature” and so forth.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin na /🔽rang gi @222a * //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo kho na mya ngan las 'das pa yin na / rang gi @222a * //
translated: If nirvana is just one’s own nature,🔽then that nature is present in all.

original: ngo bo de 'dra ba thams cad la yod pa kho na'o zhes pas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das zin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ngo bo de 'dra ba thams cad la yod pa kho na'o zhes pas sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das zin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it would follow that all sentient beings have already attained nirvana.🔽To respond to that, it is said:

original: rnam dag rnam pa can sems kyis //
analyzed: rnam dag rnam pa can sems kyis //
translated: “By the mind that has the aspect of purity”

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: and so forth.

original: glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam dag can rnam pa can te ;
analyzed: glo bur ba'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam dag can rnam pa can te ;
translated: The mind that has the aspect of purity is free from adventitious stains.

original: / gang sems des rtogs par gyur pa zhes go bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gang sems des rtogs par gyur pa zhes go bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is that mind that realizes.

original: de ltar lha'i rnal 'byor las 'di 'dra ba'i rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin mngon sum du bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar lha'i rnal 'byor las 'di 'dra ba'i rdzogs pa'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin mngon sum du bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, one should manifest the nature of this kind of perfection through the yoga of the deity.

original: de la 'dir 'gyur mod /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'gyur mod /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de ltar na lha'i gzugs lhan cig skyes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na lha'i gzugs lhan cig skyes par mi 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If it is so, then the form of the deity will not be co-emergent.🔽It is said:

original: lha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The deity, etc.

original: skyes pa tsam la ni lus can la'o //
analyzed: skyes pa tsam la ni lus can la'o //
translated: It is merely born in the body.

original: ci las she na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci las she na gsungs pa /
translated: What is it from? It is said:

original: phyag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The hands, etc.🔽If it is so, then the deity is cultivated by the perfection stage or the generation stage.

original: gal te de ltar na 'o na rdzogs pa'i rim pas sam bskyed pa'i rim pas lha bsgom pas cho ga go zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'o na rdzogs pa'i rim pas sam bskyed pa'i rim pas lha bsgom pas cho ga go zhes gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
translated: However, it is the latent tendency of the ordinary.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said:

original: tha mal pa'i lus kyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus kyi rgyu'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The cause of the ordinary body.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: That is why it is said:

original: tha mal rnam rtog 'jug las gzhan //
analyzed: tha mal rnam rtog 'jug las gzhan //
translated: Other than the engagement of ordinary concepts,

original: srid pa'i sdug bsngal ci yang med //
analyzed: srid pa'i sdug bsngal ci yang med //
translated: there is no suffering of existence at all.

original: de dang 'gal ba 'di yang ni //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba 'di yang ni //
translated: This is also the opposite of that,

original: sems su dngos su rtogs par bya //
analyzed: sems su dngos su rtogs par bya //
translated: which is directly realized as the mind.

original: zhes so // de ltar rtsod pa spangs nas //
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar rtsod pa spangs nas //
translated: Thus, having refuted the dispute,

original: skabs kho na'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa mjug sdud pa gsungs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skabs kho na'i rdzogs pa'i rim pa mjug sdud pa gsungs pa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: he teaches the conclusion of the very context of the completion stage.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor rnams kun las bla na med pa ste lhag ma med pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rang gi ngo bo /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor rnams kun las bla na med pa ste lhag ma med pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rang gi ngo bo /
translated: The yoga of the creation stage is unsurpassed, i.e., without remainder, the nature of the completion stage,🔽where sentient beings are also the buddhas.

original: gang du sems can rnams kyang sangs rgyas rnams so zhes gsungs pa'o //🔽gal te sems can rnams sangs rgyas yin na /
analyzed: gang du sems can rnams kyang sangs rgyas rnams so zhes gsungs pa'o // gal te sems can rnams sangs rgyas yin na /
translated: If sentient beings are buddhas,🔽then who are the non-buddhas?

original: 'o na sangs rgyas min pa su rnams yin zhes rtogs nas /
analyzed: 'o na sangs rgyas min pa su rnams yin zhes rtogs nas /
translated: Having understood this, the yoginīs know that the speech of the Bhagavān has no other meaning.🔽Then, the Bhagavān, in order to teach the three stages to the yoginīs,🔽said this to Vajra Mind:🔽“Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang don gzhan med pa can du shes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams gnas skabs gsum thob par gyur to zhes ston pa /🔽de nas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung yang don gzhan med pa can du shes pa'i rnal 'byor ma rnams gnas skabs gsum thob par gyur to zhes ston pa / de nas zhes pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,

original: thams cad du mi shes pa las rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje zhes pa la /
analyzed: thams cad du mi shes pa las rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje zhes pa la /
translated: Vajra Mind, Vajra Mind,🔽Vaj

original: thams cad de dgongs pa la sogs pa la mi shes pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad de dgongs pa la sogs pa la mi shes pa ni kun du rmongs pa'o //
translated: Not knowing all of that is complete delusion.

original: de las rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje ltar dbyer med cing gnod par byar med pa gang @222b du yin pa ste /
analyzed: de las rnam par rgyal ba rdo rje ltar dbyer med cing gnod par byar med pa gang @222b du yin pa ste /
translated: From that, the vajra-like victory is the indivisibility and invulnerability.

original: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin gyi ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs nas gsungs pa /
translated: Having entered into the meditative stabilization that is the nature of the mind of enlightenment, he spoke.

original: sems can rnams sangs rgyas kho na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams sangs rgyas kho na zhes pa'o //
translated: Sentient beings are only buddhas.

original: de ltar ni de bzhin nyid kho na rang nyid rnam par dag pa sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de ltar ni de bzhin nyid kho na rang nyid rnam par dag pa sangs rgyas te /
translated: In that way, suchness itself is the pure buddha.

original: de yang rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin kho nas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: And that is pure by nature alone.

original: ci'i phyir 'di ltar mi shes she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di ltar mi shes she na /
translated: Why is it not known in that way?

original: gsungs pa / 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa / 'on kyang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said Nevertheless, and so forth.

original: dri ma ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / dri ma de bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa las sangs rgyas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang / dri ma de bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa las sangs rgyas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The defilements are the afflictive obstructions, the obstructions to omniscience, and the defilements together with their predispositions. From the abandonment of those, buddhahood is to be realized.

original: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes pa /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes pa /
translated: This is just like that.

original: ngas rtogs par byas pa'i don 'di ni bden pa ste ;
analyzed: ngas rtogs par byas pa'i don 'di ni bden pa ste ;
translated: The meaning that I have understood is true;

original: 'di la the tshom dang phyin ci log dag bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la the tshom dang phyin ci log dag bskyed par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: doubt and error should not be generated in this.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa bcom ldan 'das rnams te yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams zhes mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams bod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa bcom ldan 'das rnams te yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa rnams zhes mi bskyod pa la sogs pa rnams bod pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is the Blessed Ones, those endowed with right knowledge, Akṣobhya and so forth are referred to.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod la 'di rnams bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod la 'di rnams bshad par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, these should be explained to you.

original: gal te dri ma rnams kyis bsgribs pa ni de rnams kyis bsgribs pa kho na ste 'di rnams la byang chub gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dri ma rnams kyis bsgribs pa ni de rnams kyis bsgribs pa kho na ste 'di rnams la byang chub gal zhe na /
translated: If they are obscured by the stains, they are obscured by them alone, and enlightenment is far away for them.

original: 'di ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma yin te /
translated: But it is not like that.

original: lha bsgom pas dri ma 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha bsgom pas dri ma 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the stains are removed by meditating on the deity.

original: gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: gsungs pa ni /
translated: It is said:

original: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
translated: But the latent tendencies of the ordinary are.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir 'di spang ba'i ched du dang rang gi bag chags kyi rten yongs su gso ba'i ched du lha bsgom pa don med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir 'di spang ba'i ched du dang rang gi bag chags kyi rten yongs su gso ba'i ched du lha bsgom pa don med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, meditating on the deity is not meaningless for the purpose of abandoning that and for the purpose of completely healing the basis of one's latent tendencies.

original: 'o na bag chags kho na sun 'byin na /
analyzed: 'o na bag chags kho na sun 'byin na /
translated: But if the latent impressions are just eliminated,

original: lha'i rnal 'byor gyi bag chags gzhan bskyed par bya ba de ci ste /
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor gyi bag chags gzhan bskyed par bya ba de ci ste /
translated: why should another latent impression of divine yoga be generated?🔽This is hard to accept, even the abandonment of the apprehension of ordinariness,

original: 'di tha mal du 'dzin pa spong ba yang bzod par dka'o zhes dogs par byas nas dpe mang po rnams kyis 'di bsgrub pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di tha mal du 'dzin pa spong ba yang bzod par dka'o zhes dogs par byas nas dpe mang po rnams kyis 'di bsgrub pa'i ched du gsungs pa /
translated: so, in order to establish this, he states many examples:

original: brgyal ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyal ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Swoons, etc.”

original: 'jig rten sems dpa' med gang gis //
analyzed: 'jig rten sems dpa' med gang gis //
translated: By what, in the world, is the mind of a hero

original: dus zos pas na brgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus zos pas na brgyal bar 'gyur //
translated: consumed by time, and so swoons?

original: dug med par byed pa la yid kyi las ni 'dir sems pa'o //
analyzed: dug med par byed pa la yid kyi las ni 'dir sems pa'o //
translated: The mental action here is the intention to render the poison ineffective.

original: rmongs spangs ni dug gi de kho na nyid ces pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs spangs ni dug gi de kho na nyid ces pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The abandonment of delusion is because of the reality of the poison.

original: dug 'phrog pa'i de kho na nyid la mkhas pa ni de nyid shes pa'i yid can no //
analyzed: dug 'phrog pa'i de kho na nyid la mkhas pa ni de nyid shes pa'i yid can no //
translated: Skill in the reality of the removal of poison is the mind that knows reality.

original: gang zhe na 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhe na 'jug go //
translated: What? It enters.

original: de'i mchog tu gcod de /
analyzed: de'i mchog tu gcod de /
translated: It is cut off as supreme.

original: mya ngan ni dug zos pa'i gdung ba las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan ni dug zos pa'i gdung ba las skyes pa'o //
translated: Sorrow is born from the torment of consuming poison.

original: dug ces pa ni dug nyid do //
analyzed: dug ces pa ni dug nyid do //
translated: The poison is the poison itself.

original: rlung gis rlung ni 'joms par byed //
analyzed: rlung gis rlung ni 'joms par byed //
translated: Wind destroys wind.

original: ces pa sran m'a sha ni rlung bskyed de /
analyzed: ces pa sran m'a sha ni rlung bskyed de /
translated: The word “beans” is a metaphor for wind.

original: @223a * // des yun ring por bsags pa'i rlung 'byin du 'jug par byed bzhin pas 'byin par byed do //
analyzed: @223a * // des yun ring por bsags pa'i rlung 'byin du 'jug par byed bzhin pas 'byin par byed do //
translated: It causes the wind that has been accumulated for a long time to be expelled, and thus it expels.

original: de 'di ni bzlog pa'i sman te nad dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'di ni bzlog pa'i sman te nad dang rigs mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is the medicine for that, because it is of the same type as the disease.

original: dper bya gsungs pa /
analyzed: dper bya gsungs pa /
translated: An example is stated:

original: srid pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Existence, etc.”

original: srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: srid pa ni 'khor ba ste /
translated: Existence is samsara.

original: de dag pa ni zad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag pa ni zad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Its purification is its exhaustion.

original: srid pa kho nas zhes pa 'jig rten pa'i lam kho nas bsgom par bya bzhin pa rdzogs pa'i rim pas sam bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: srid pa kho nas zhes pa 'jig rten pa'i lam kho nas bsgom par bya bzhin pa rdzogs pa'i rim pas sam bskyed pa'i rim pas so //
translated: By existence alone, by the mundane path alone, the stage of completion or the stage of generation is cultivated.

original: de ltar ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ji srid pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ji srid pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam ste /
translated: Thus, the mundane path is as far as the factors conducive to penetration.

original: de med par 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa med cing /
analyzed: de med par 'jig rten las 'das pa mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa med cing /
translated: Without that, the supramundane path of seeing, etc., does not exist.

original: de med par srid pa zad pa med do //
analyzed: de med par srid pa zad pa med do //
translated: Without that, the exhaustion of existence does not exist.

original: de'i phyir brgyud pas srid pa kho nas srid pa zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgyud pas srid pa kho nas srid pa zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, existence alone, by way of its continuum, becomes the exhaustion of existence.

original: rnam rtog kyang 'khor bskyed par byed pa ni rab tu rnam par rtog las dag par 'gyur te brgyud pas so //
analyzed: rnam rtog kyang 'khor bskyed par byed pa ni rab tu rnam par rtog las dag par 'gyur te brgyud pas so //
translated: Conceptualization also generates cyclic existence, but it is purified by the process of thorough analysis.

original: de ltar ni yang dag par so sor brtag pa yang rnam par rtog pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni yang dag par so sor brtag pa yang rnam par rtog pa kho na ste /
translated: In this way, correct analysis is itself conceptualization,

original: de nyid kyis kyang sgom pa'i stobs bskyed pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis kyang sgom pa'i stobs bskyed pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes skyed par byed do //
translated: but it generates nonconceptual wisdom by the power of meditation.

original: des kyang bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i rnam par rtog pa bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad zad par byed do //
analyzed: des kyang bsgom pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i mthar thug pa'i rnam par rtog pa bag chags dang bcas pa thams cad zad par byed do //
translated: And that eliminates all conceptualizations, along with their imprints, that are the culmination of the conceptualizations of meditation.

original: dpe gzhan gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpe gzhan gyis gsungs pa /
translated: An example is stated:

original: rna bar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rna bar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the ear, etc.

original: dngos po'i rnam rtog ni tha mal pa phung po lnga la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam rtog ni tha mal pa phung po lnga la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptualization of things is the ordinary conceptualization of the five aggregates, etc.

original: rnam pa rnams kyis zhes pa /
analyzed: rnam pa rnams kyis zhes pa /
translated: By the aspects

original: rim pa dag gis rtag pa dang rin chen dbang po la sogs pa lha'i rang gi ngo bo bsgom par bya ba rnams kyis /
analyzed: rim pa dag gis rtag pa dang rin chen dbang po la sogs pa lha'i rang gi ngo bo bsgom par bya ba rnams kyis /
translated: means by the stages of the aspects of the divine nature of Ratnasambhava, etc., which are to be cultivated.

original: dag par byed de /
analyzed: dag par byed de /
translated: It purifies

original: zad par byed do //
analyzed: zad par byed do //
translated: It is exhausted.

original: 'khor ba bskyed pa la rtsa ba ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba bskyed pa la rtsa ba ni gti mug ste /
translated: In the generation of cyclic existence, ignorance is the root.

original: de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags ni de ma thag pa'i rgyu'o zhes pas /🔽gti mug gi gnyen po rnam par rtog pa gzhan rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba can gyi 'dod chags ni de ma thag pa'i rgyu'o zhes pas / gti mug gi gnyen po rnam par rtog pa gzhan rtogs par byas nas /
translated: Desire, which has that as its root, is the immediate cause.

original: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang de dang 'dra ba rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi gnyen po yang de dang 'dra ba rtogs par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, having understood the antidote to ignorance, one should understand the antidote to desire in the same way.

original: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽'dod chags ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o // 'dod chags ni nyon mongs pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: It is said:

original: de kho na me dang / des tshig pa ni kun nas me ste /
analyzed: de kho na me dang / des tshig pa ni kun nas me ste /
translated: As desire is the fire, and that which is burned by it is the all-consuming fire,

original: ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gro la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'bar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the suffering of the miserable realms, etc. is blazing.

original: 'dod chags ni de kho na nyid @223b dang ro gcig pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni de kho na nyid @223b dang ro gcig pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Desire is the desire that is one taste with reality.

original: de kho na me ste /
analyzed: de kho na me ste /
translated: That is the fire,

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i bud shing sreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it burns the fuel of afflictions and discursive thoughts.

original: de dug tu bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya'o //
analyzed: de dug tu bya ba ni yongs su smin par bya'o //
translated: One should poison it, that is, fully ripen it.

original: 'o na 'dod chags ni las drag po nyid de /
analyzed: 'o na 'dod chags ni las drag po nyid de /
translated: Now, desire is indeed a powerful karma.

original: 'khor ba bskyed pa la bar du mchod pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir te de nyid kyi phyir sdom brtson rnams kyis de kho na gtso bor yongs su spang bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor ba bskyed pa la bar du mchod pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir te de nyid kyi phyir sdom brtson rnams kyis de kho na gtso bor yongs su spang bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: Because it is the cause of the obstacle to the generation of samsara. Therefore, those who strive for the vows should completely abandon just that.🔽The reply is:

original: gsungs pa / gang dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gang dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Whatever” and so forth.

original: ni ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ni ste gang gi phyir /
translated: “Indeed” means “because.”

original: gang dang gang gis zhes pa khyab par 'dod pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang gis zhes pa khyab par 'dod pa bstan pa ste /
translated: “Whatever” and “by whatever” teach the pervasion.

original: 'dod chags kho na'i gsal ba'i dbye ba nyer bar blangs nas skye ba brgyud pa dpag tu med par rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags kho na'i gsal ba'i dbye ba nyer bar blangs nas skye ba brgyud pa dpag tu med par rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The meaning taught is that, having taken up the specific divisions of just desire, it is the cause for the immeasurable succession of births.

original: thabs ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni stong pa nyid kyi ye shes la sogs pa'o //
translated: The method is the wisdom of emptiness and so forth.

original: 'dir zhar byung las zhe sdang las skyes pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa las drag po dang / thabs snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba la sogs pa dgongs pa'o zhes gsal bar byas te /
analyzed: 'dir zhar byung las zhe sdang las skyes pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa las drag po dang / thabs snying rje chen po dang sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bsrung ba la sogs pa dgongs pa'o zhes gsal bar byas te /
translated: Here, as a digression, it is clarified that the intention is that the killing and so forth that arise from anger are more intense, and the method is great compassion and the protection of the Buddha’s teaching and so forth.

original: brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not expressed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyir 'phangs nas khyad par du 'dod chags kho na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyir 'phangs nas khyad par du 'dod chags kho na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, in general, having been cast down, he speaks of just passion in particular.

original: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words passion, etc.

original: bzlog pa zhes pa ni mthun phyogs su gyur pa yang mthun phyogs ma yin par snang ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bzlog pa zhes pa ni mthun phyogs su gyur pa yang mthun phyogs ma yin par snang ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The word reversed is because that which is favorable appears as unfavorable.

original: / don dam par ni gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa kho na'o //🔽sangs rgyas kho na ston pas khas blangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: / don dam par ni gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa kho na'o // sangs rgyas kho na ston pas khas blangs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas te /
translated: But in the ultimate sense, it is only that which is favorable to the antidote.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i snying po rdo rje theg pa la mi mos pa'i phyir mu stegs pa dang 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas mu stegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i snying po rdo rje theg pa la mi mos pa'i phyir mu stegs pa dang 'dra ba ni sangs rgyas mu stegs pa rnams so //
translated: The word heretic is one who is not a Buddhist, because he does not believe in the Vajra Vehicle, the essence of the Buddha's teaching.

original: de ltar lha'i rnal 'byor med par dngos grub med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar lha'i rnal 'byor med par dngos grub med do zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, he teaches that without the yoga of the deity, there is no power.

original: 'o na 'di ltar mi 'bad pa'i myur pa kho nar skyon nyams par 'gyur zhes grub cing /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar mi 'bad pa'i myur pa kho nar skyon nyams par 'gyur zhes grub cing /
translated: But if one does not strive in this way, the fault is that power is lost, as has been established.

original: lam 'di kho nas ni ma yin la /
analyzed: lam 'di kho nas ni ma yin la /
translated: But it is not by this path alone that power is lost,🔽 and it is not by this path alone that power is gained.

original: dug la sogs pa rnams kho nas dug la sogs pa rnams 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dug la sogs pa rnams kho nas dug la sogs pa rnams 'jig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Poisons and so forth are not destroyed by poisons and so forth alone,

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang nyams pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang nyams pa mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because their destruction is seen in other ways as well.

original: 'di la yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la yang gsungs pa /
translated: Here, it is also said:

original: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mal bag chags so //
translated: However, the ordinary latent tendencies.

original: zhes so // tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang khyad par gyur pa'i ngo bo bskyed par la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // tha mal pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang khyad par gyur pa'i ngo bo bskyed par la 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that even the ordinary conceptualizations do not arise to generate the nature of the transformed state,

original: bden te / 'on kyang khyad par du gyur pa'i ngo bo bskyed pa @224a * //
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang khyad par du gyur pa'i ngo bo bskyed pa @224a * //
translated: it is true, but the generation of the nature of the transformed state

original: yang rang bzhin las rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid la de'i rang bzhin du bsgom pa kho nas de ldog pa las so /
analyzed: yang rang bzhin las rdo rje 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid la de'i rang bzhin du bsgom pa kho nas de ldog pa las so /
translated: is from the reversal of that nature from its natural state, by meditating on the nature of Vajradhara alone.

original: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor las dngos grub tu bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar shes rab dang thabs kyi bdag nyid lha'i rnal 'byor las dngos grub tu bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the powers that arise from the yoga of the deity, which is the nature of wisdom and method,🔽now, in order to explain the powers that arise from the yoga of the mantra, which is the essence of the deity, it says “the mantra” and so on.

original: de kho na chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa gzhan gyi don dang ro gcig par ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na chos thams cad rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa gzhan gyi don dang ro gcig par ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: The reality of all things is the mandala circle in the form of the essence of purity, and it is taught to be of one taste with the benefit of others.

original: kundu ru la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kundu ru la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning with “In the kunda-ru” teaches that.

original: kundu ru rnams ni shin tu dga' ba rdo rje lha mo'i padma las byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: kundu ru rnams ni shin tu dga' ba rdo rje lha mo'i padma las byung ba rnams te /
translated: The kunda-rus are born from the lotus of the Vajra Goddess of Great Joy.

original: kun du ru zhes pa brtag pa gnyis par ro //🔽kun du ru de rnams la 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun du ru zhes pa brtag pa gnyis par ro // kun du ru de rnams la 'gyur te /
translated: The kunda-ru is mentioned in the second chapter.

original: reg pa lnga rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg pa lnga rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: Those kunda-rus are the five contacts.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bos so //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang nam mkha'i khams kyi ngo bos so //
translated: They are the essences of the elements of earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: 'byung ba rnams kyang ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba rnams kyang ci zhe na /
translated: What are the elements?

original: gsungs pa / gcig nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / gcig nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, “The one, etc. ”

original: dga' ba chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The Great Joy is the Vajra Holder, the innate joy.

original: dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa 'byung ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dbye ba rnams kyis zhes pa 'byung ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: By the divisions means by the divisions of the elements.

original: de kho na 'byung ba lnga'i rang gi ngo bo can shin tu rnam par dag pa lngar ston pa gsungs pa /🔽bo la  zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽bo la ni rdo rje /
analyzed: de kho na 'byung ba lnga'i rang gi ngo bo can shin tu rnam par dag pa lngar ston pa gsungs pa / bo la  zhes pa la sogs pa ste / bo la ni rdo rje /
translated: He declares:

original: ka kko la ni padma'o //
analyzed: ka kko la ni padma'o //
translated: The vajra is the earth, the lotus is the water,🔽the fire is the jewel, the wind is the sword, and the space is the bell.

original: gang 'di sra ba'i bag chags ni gti mug gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: gang 'di sra ba'i bag chags ni gti mug gi ngo bo'o //
translated: The habitual tendency of solidity is the essence of delusion.

original: de kho na rnam par dag pa ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: de kho na rnam par dag pa ni gti mug ste /
translated: That very thing, when pure, is delusion.

original: rnam par dag pa'i 'dir sra ba'i ngo bo sa'i khams rnam par snang mdzad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i 'dir sra ba'i ngo bo sa'i khams rnam par snang mdzad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The earth element, which has the essence of solidity, should be called Vairochana.

original: bcad cing phug pa'i chu rnams slar yang de ltar 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcad cing phug pa'i chu rnams slar yang de ltar 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: The water element is called Akashagarbha, because the water that is cut and pierced is again gathered in that way.

original: de ltar gnas pa rnams gcod pa dang / 'byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' lta bu nyid kyi phyir na chu rnams bskyod bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa rnams gcod pa dang / 'byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' lta bu nyid kyi phyir na chu rnams bskyod bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir mi bskyod pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The water element is the essence of Akshobhya, because the water element is not to be moved, since it is impossible to cut and pierce that which abides in that way, and because it is like space.

original: zhe sdang gi gang chos thams cad dngos po med pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' lta bu nyid kyi phyir zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gang chos thams cad dngos po med pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / nam mkha' lta bu nyid kyi phyir zhe sdang ste /
translated: Hatred is in the fire, because all things are insubstantial, and because it is space-like.

original: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: zhe sdang rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo mi bskyod pa bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Lord Akshobhya is the essence of the purification of hatred.

original: gzi brjid med pa mgo bor gyur pa rnams kyi 'dod chags lhag pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni me la'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid med pa mgo bor gyur pa rnams kyi 'dod chags lhag pa med pa'i phyir 'dod chags ni me la'o //
translated: Desire is in the water, because of the excess of desire of those whose heads are submerged in the water.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i me'i khams dang 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i me'i khams dang 'dod chags ni 'od dpag tu med pa rdo rjer 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fire element and desire are purified in Amitabha.

original: de ni g-yo ba'i ngo bo can //
analyzed: de ni g-yo ba'i ngo bo can //
translated: It is the essence of movement.

original: zhes pa / rlung gi ngo bo can kho na'i sems ka kko la @224b ru 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa / rlung gi ngo bo can kho na'i sems ka kko la @224b ru 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind, which is of the nature of wind, goes into the kakkola.

original: de'i phyir phrag dog kyang de la gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrag dog kyang de la gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, jealousy is also clear in that.

original: de gnyis rnam par dag pa don yod grub pa bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de gnyis rnam par dag pa don yod grub pa bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The purification of those two is the Lord Amoghasiddhi.

original: bde ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Bliss is the innate joy.

original: de kho na ni chags pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de kho na ni chags pa'i sems te /
translated: That is the mind of passion.

original: de la kun nas zhen pa'i sems ni de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun nas zhen pa'i sems ni de las gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The mind that is attached to that is not different from that.

original: de kho na dga' ba mchog rgyas par byed do zhes pas rin chen chags pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na dga' ba mchog rgyas par byed do zhes pas rin chen chags pa'o //
translated: That is the nature of the jewel, since it is said that “it causes the expansion of the supreme joy of reality.”

original: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi sems ni bdag la chags pa 'di'i mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo zhes pas chags pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
analyzed: bde ba'i bdag nyid kyi sems ni bdag la chags pa 'di'i mtshan nyid de rang gi ngo bo zhes pas chags pa'i mtshan nyid can no //
translated: The mind that has the nature of bliss is the characteristic of attachment to the self. Since it is said to be “one’s own nature,” it has the characteristic of attachment.

original: de yang nam mkha' rnam par dag pa'i khams kho na ste /
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' rnam par dag pa'i khams kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the element of pure space.

original: don dam par rang bzhin med par chos mthun pa nyid kyis nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par rang bzhin med par chos mthun pa nyid kyis nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is similar to space because of the similarity of its nature, which is ultimately without intrinsic reality.

original: des kyang chos rnams thams cad so sor cha shas su phye ba las stong par byed pas phra ma'i ngo bor de 'gyur te /
analyzed: des kyang chos rnams thams cad so sor cha shas su phye ba las stong par byed pas phra ma'i ngo bor de 'gyur te /
translated: Since it also makes all phenomena empty by dividing them into individual parts, it has the nature of slander.

original: de gnyis ka rnam par dag pa phra ma rdo rje'o ;
analyzed: de gnyis ka rnam par dag pa phra ma rdo rje'o ;
translated: The purification of both of those is the vajra of slander.

original: / de ltar khams lnga dang nyon mongs pa lnga rnams rnam par dag pa rnams sangs rgyas lnga rnams su 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de ltar khams lnga dang nyon mongs pa lnga rnams rnam par dag pa rnams sangs rgyas lnga rnams su 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, the five elements and the five afflictions become the five buddhas through their purification.

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ye shes lnga rnams dang phung po lnga rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i ye shes lnga rnams dang phung po lnga rnams kyang ngo //
translated: The five pristine awarenesses and the five aggregates, which will be explained below, are also [the five buddhas].

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su yang rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po 'di rnams yang dag par 'byung ba kho na ste /
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i gnas skabs su yang rang bzhin yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas lnga po 'di rnams yang dag par 'byung ba kho na ste /
translated: Even in the impure state, these five buddhas, who are completely pure by nature, arise just as they are.

original: glo bur gyi dri mas gos pa rnams nye bar mi mtshon no //
analyzed: glo bur gyi dri mas gos pa rnams nye bar mi mtshon no //
translated: They are not indicated as being covered by adventitious stains.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni rang bzhin rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni rang bzhin rnam par dag pa nye bar bzung nas /
translated: The yogis and yoginis, having taken hold of the completely pure nature,

original: dag pa kho nar mos par bya zhing /
analyzed: dag pa kho nar mos par bya zhing /
translated: should have conviction in the purity alone.

original: de'i rigs can mig la sogs pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de'i rigs can mig la sogs pa rnams kyang /
translated: The eyes and so forth, which are of the same type,

original: byang chub sems dpa' dag par kho nar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dag par kho nar nges par gzung bar bya'o //
translated: should be ascertained as being pure bodhisattvas.

original: mjug sdud gsungs pa /
analyzed: mjug sdud gsungs pa /
translated: The summary is stated

original: gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: in a single moment,

original: sems chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: sems chen po ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: the great mind is coemergent joy.

original: lnga'i ngo bos ni rigs lnga'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: lnga'i ngo bos ni rigs lnga'i ngo bos so //
translated: By the nature of five, by the nature of the five families.

original: de la btsun mo'i kundu ru la so sor rigs rnams la rigs du ma skyes pa ston pa /
analyzed: de la btsun mo'i kundu ru la so sor rigs rnams la rigs du ma skyes pa ston pa /
translated: In this regard, the universal of the queen shows the arising of many types in the various types.

original: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lnga zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five, etc.

original: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary is stated:

original: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽gcig gi rang gi dngos po ni rigs mtha' yas pa'i thun mong ba'i ngo bo mchog tu rtag pa ste rigs mtha' yas pa rnams sprul @225a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste / gcig gi rang gi dngos po ni rigs mtha' yas pa'i thun mong ba'i ngo bo mchog tu rtag pa ste rigs mtha' yas pa rnams sprul @225a * //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: par byed cing mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par byed cing mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of one is the supreme, eternal nature common to the infinite types, because the infinite types emanate and abide for an endless time.

original: de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i sems kyis bde ba chen po'i rab tu dbye ba rigs lnga rnams so zhes bsgrubs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa rnam pa lnga'i sems kyis bde ba chen po'i rab tu dbye ba rigs lnga rnams so zhes bsgrubs so //
translated: Thus, the five types of mind, such as passion and aggression, are established as the five types of the divisions of great bliss.

original: de rnams kyi yang rab tu dbye ba grangs med pa'i rigs rnams so zhes bsgrub pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyi yang rab tu dbye ba grangs med pa'i rigs rnams so zhes bsgrub pa'i ched du tshigs su bcad pa gnyis gsungs pa /
translated: In order to establish that their divisions are the infinite types, two verses are stated:

original: bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bcu zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The ten, etc.

original: bye ma rnams dang mnyam pa'i grangs so //
analyzed: bye ma rnams dang mnyam pa'i grangs so //
translated: The number is equal to the number of sand particles.

original: rigs gcig rnams la ni rigs rnams re re la'o //
analyzed: rigs gcig rnams la ni rigs rnams re re la'o //
translated: For those of one type, they are for each of the types.

original: tshogs kyi rigs rnams la zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs de rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi rigs rnams te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi rigs rnams la zhes pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs de rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi rigs rnams te /
translated: For the types of the assembly, the types are as many as there are assemblies of the Tathāgatas.

original: don de kho na logs su byas pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: don de kho na logs su byas pa'i phyir ro /
translated: That very meaning is made separate.

original: de'i phyir yang tshogs kyi grangs kyi rigs rnams ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang tshogs kyi grangs kyi rigs rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, the types of the number of assemblies are

original: tshogs kyi grangs rnams te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi grangs rnams te /
translated: the numbers of the assemblies.

original: gang+g'a'i klung lnga bcu'i bye ma dang mnyam pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang+g'a'i klung lnga bcu'i bye ma dang mnyam pa rnams so //
translated: They are equal to the number of grains of sand in fifty Ganges Rivers.

original: tshogs kyi rigs de rnams slar yang rab tu dbye bar bya bzhin pa rnams la rigs du ma rnams so zhes pas rigs shin tu mang po rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi rigs de rnams slar yang rab tu dbye bar bya bzhin pa rnams la rigs du ma rnams so zhes pas rigs shin tu mang po rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Those types of the assembly, when further divided, have many types, as it is said that they are of many types. They become very many types.

original: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa de rnams la zhes pa tshogs kyi rigs rnams la ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa de rnams la zhes pa tshogs kyi rigs rnams la ste /
translated: How so? It is said: for them, for the types of the assembly,

original: dang por dbye bar bya bzhin pa rnams la so sor rigs brgya'i grangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang por dbye bar bya bzhin pa rnams la so sor rigs brgya'i grangs rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: first, when divided, they become the number of one hundred types each.

original: rigs brgya po de rnams kyang slar yang phye ba rnams so sor rigs 'bum rnams su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs brgya po de rnams kyang slar yang phye ba rnams so sor rigs 'bum rnams su 'gyur ro //
translated: Those one hundred families are again divided, and each one becomes one hundred thousand families.

original: rigs 'bum phye ba na so sor rigs bye ba rnams so //
analyzed: rigs 'bum phye ba na so sor rigs bye ba rnams so //
translated: When the one hundred thousand families are divided, there are one million families.

original: rigs bye ba la yang phye ba rnams la so sor rigs grangs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: rigs bye ba la yang phye ba rnams la so sor rigs grangs med pa rnams so //
translated: When the one million families are divided, there are countless families.

original: de la rigs rnams la zhes pa rigs bye ba rnams la gang so sor grangs med pa'i rigs de rnams thams cad ni mchog tu dga' ba kho na rigs te /
analyzed: de la rigs rnams la zhes pa rigs bye ba rnams la gang so sor grangs med pa'i rigs de rnams thams cad ni mchog tu dga' ba kho na rigs te /
translated: Among those families, the one hundred thousand families that are each divided into countless families are all of the family of supreme joy.

original: de las byung ba rnams so //🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rigs gcig po de ni rigs kyi dbye ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes de ltar rtogs par byas nas lha mos gsol pa /
analyzed: de las byung ba rnams so // lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rigs gcig po de ni rigs kyi dbye ba thams cad kyi rtsa ba nyid kyi phyir ro zhes de ltar rtogs par byas nas lha mos gsol pa /
translated: They arise from that.

original: rdul gyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid can ni shin tu chung ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rdul gyi ngo bo'i mtshan nyid can ni shin tu chung ba'i 'o //
translated: Since that one family of innate joy is the root of all the divisions of the family, having understood it in that way, the goddess said, “The nature of the atom is very small.”

original: shin tu chung ba tshad can gyi gong bu'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi rigs ni rigs grangs med pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dang skyes pa'i rgyu dang rten du gsungs te /
analyzed: shin tu chung ba tshad can gyi gong bu'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i bdag nyid kyi rigs ni rigs grangs med pa rnams kyi rang gi ngo bo dang skyes pa'i rgyu dang rten du gsungs te /
translated: The lineage of the essence of the drop of the bodhicitta of innate joy, which is of a limited, very small size, is said to be the nature, cause, and support of the countless lineages.

original: 'di 'di las dogs pa ci lags pa'o //
analyzed: 'di 'di las dogs pa ci lags pa'o //
translated: What is the doubt here?

original: spangs par 'dis 'byung bar byas te /
analyzed: spangs par 'dis 'byung bar byas te /
translated: It is made to arise by this.🔽If it were otherwise, there would be distress.

original: cig shos ltar na @225b gdung bar 'gyur ro zhe na cig ni zhes pa cig la'o //
analyzed: cig shos ltar na @225b gdung bar 'gyur ro zhe na cig ni zhes pa cig la'o //
translated: “One” is for one.

original: bye ma zhes pa bye ma ni byang chub sems kyi rdul phran no //
analyzed: bye ma zhes pa bye ma ni byang chub sems kyi rdul phran no //
translated: “Sand” is the atom of bodhicitta.

original: de kho na lam ste der ro //
analyzed: de kho na lam ste der ro //
translated: That is the path, there.

original: sgra'i lam la zhes pa 'don pa la ni ba spu'i bu gar ro //
analyzed: sgra'i lam la zhes pa 'don pa la ni ba spu'i bu gar ro //
translated: “On the path of sound” is in the pores.

original: dog pa zhes pa dog pa nyid do //
analyzed: dog pa zhes pa dog pa nyid do //
translated: “Narrow” is narrowness.

original: bzhengs shig ces pa bzhengs nas te spros nas so //
analyzed: bzhengs shig ces pa bzhengs nas te spros nas so //
translated: “Arise” is to arise, to emanate.

original: zlos pa nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: zlos pa nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: The repetition is definitely shown.

original: spro ba byed pa'i gsal ba'i dbye ba grangs med pa nye bar blangs nas spro ba'i rgyun brgyud pa dpag tu med pa rab tu bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: spro ba byed pa'i gsal ba'i dbye ba grangs med pa nye bar blangs nas spro ba'i rgyun brgyud pa dpag tu med pa rab tu bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: Having taken up the countless varieties of the clear manifestation of delight, for the sake of displaying the infinite continuity of manifestation.

original: 'di rnams kyi stobs bcu rnams yin pas na stobs bcu pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi stobs bcu rnams yin pas na stobs bcu pa rnams so //
translated: Since these are the ten powers, they are the ten powers.

original: de rnams kyis kyang sna tshogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pas gdul bya'i skya bo 'dun pa'i don du rtse bar byed rol par byed pas na lha rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su bdag rdo rje 'dzin pa'i khyim zhes pa khyim du ste
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang sna tshogs pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul la sogs pas gdul bya'i skya bo 'dun pa'i don du rtse bar byed rol par byed pas na lha rnams te de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su bdag rdo rje 'dzin pa'i khyim zhes pa khyim du ste
translated: And since they also play and enjoy with various miracles and magical displays for the sake of attracting the beings to be tamed, they are the gods, the tathagatas. In my house, the house of Vajradhara,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bde ba chen po'i ston mo gsol bar bzhed pa rnams zhugs shig dang bzhugs shig ces pa lhag ma ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i skur bde ba chen po'i ston mo gsol bar bzhed pa rnams zhugs shig dang bzhugs shig ces pa lhag ma ste /
translated: those who wish to enjoy the great bliss banquet in the sambhogakaya, please enter, please remain. The rest is self-evident.

original: ji ltar thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar thub pa'i dgongs pa'i rgyan du bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as it is explained in the Ornament of the Sage's Thought.

original: ji ltar na 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di ltar yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it so? It is said:

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes pa la sogs pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the power of their miracles” and so forth

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston te des so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu bsam gyis mi khyab pa ston te des so //
translated: demonstrates the inconceivable power of the miracles of the tathāgatas.

original: rigs kyi rdo rje sems dpa'i sras rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so ;
analyzed: rigs kyi rdo rje sems dpa'i sras rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so ;
translated: The sons of Vajrasattva are the tathāgatas.🔽“

original: / byung ba rnams so zhes pa yang dag par 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: / byung ba rnams so zhes pa yang dag par 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Arisen” means “perfectly arisen.”

original: 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ji ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i lus la ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu yang rigs grangs med pa rnams cig car du skye zhing gnas la /
analyzed: ji ltar longs spyod rdzogs pa'i lus la ba spu'i khung bu gcig tu yang rigs grangs med pa rnams cig car du skye zhing gnas la /
translated: Just as in the body of perfect enjoyment, in a single pore of the skin, the countless families of tathāgatas are born simultaneously and abide,

original: de rnams dog pa yang ma yin btsir ba yang ma yin rten yangs pa yang ma yin pa ni bla na med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu phul du byung ba las yin pa de ltar bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi khu ba rdul phra
analyzed: de rnams dog pa yang ma yin btsir ba yang ma yin rten yangs pa yang ma yin pa ni bla na med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu phul du byung ba las yin pa de ltar bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi khu ba rdul phra
translated: and they are neither cramped nor crowded, nor is the pore of the skin expanded, this is due to the preeminence of the inconceivable and unsurpassed power of their miracles.

original: rab gcig la yang mi 'gal ba kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rab gcig la yang mi 'gal ba kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In just the same way, there is no contradiction at all in the single particle of the bodhicitta of bliss.

original: 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni de ltar khams la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rigs ma lus pa'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje'o zhes dngos nyid du gsungs nas /🔽yang gtso bor nas khams dang ye shes dang phung po'i rang gi ngo bo 'di'o zhes rtogs pa'i ched du gsungs pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ci stsal pa zhe na nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽yang @226a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bka' stsal pa zhes pa ni de ltar khams la brten pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas rigs ma lus pa'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje'o zhes dngos nyid du gsungs nas / yang gtso bor nas khams dang ye shes dang phung po'i rang gi ngo bo 'di'o zhes rtogs pa'i ched du gsungs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' ci stsal pa zhe na nyon zhes pa la sogs pa'o // yang @226a * //
translated: Thus, having stated the reality of the vajra of the mind of enlightenment, the nature of the entire spiritual family, by way of the purification of the addictions based on the elements, he then states the chief of the family in order to make known the nature of the elements, intuition, and the aggregates.🔽What did the Lord say? Listen! and so on.🔽Again, the chief of the family is the vajra of the mind of enlightenment.

original: dag sbyor 'byung mtshan nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo ste /🔽bye brag tu bshad pa'i khyad par rnams kyi dang por rnam par bshad zin to //🔽yang na yang dag sbyor ni phyi rol gyi shes rab dang thabs kyi padma dang rdo rje dag dang nang gi gtum mo dang khu ba dag sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: dag sbyor 'byung mtshan nyid ni rdo rje sems dpa'i rang gi ngo bo ste /🔽bye brag tu bshad pa'i khyad par rnams kyi dang por rnam par bshad zin to //🔽yang na yang dag sbyor ni phyi rol gyi shes rab dang thabs kyi padma dang rdo rje dag dang nang gi gtum mo dang khu ba dag sbyor ba'o //
translated: Thus, having spoken the reality of the nature of the mind of enlightenment, the vajra of the lineage without exception, by way of the purification of the afflictions based on the elements, he again, in order to understand the nature of the elements, the pristine wisdoms, and the aggregates, said the vajra of the aggregates, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the aggregates, he said the vajra of the aggregates, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the elements, he said the vajra of the elements, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the pristine wisdoms, he said the vajra of the pristine wisdoms, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind, he said the vajra of the body, etc., and in order to understand the nature of the body, speech, and mind

original: de yod na 'byung ngo zhes pa 'byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
analyzed: de yod na 'byung ngo zhes pa 'byung ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin byang chub kyi sems rdo rje'o //
translated: The arising is the bodhicitta, which is the nature of the innate joy, the vajra.

original: de gang gis mtshon par bya ba de ni mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de gang gis mtshon par bya ba de ni mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is characterized by that is the characteristic.

original: gsang ba ni kundu ru ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni kundu ru ste /
translated: The secret is the kundalini.

original: de la yod pa ni gsang chen sa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la yod pa ni gsang chen sa'i khams so //
translated: That which exists in that is the great secret, the earth element.

original: de'i phyir mchog gi phul du byung ba chu ste sdud par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog gi phul du byung ba chu ste sdud par byed pa nyid kyis 'dod chags bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the supreme is the water, which is the best, because it generates passion by the very act of collecting.

original: dgyes pa ni me ste me yod na 'dod chags lhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa ni me ste me yod na 'dod chags lhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The joy is the fire, because passion increases when there is fire.

original: rlung ni thams cad bdag nyid de /
analyzed: rlung ni thams cad bdag nyid de /
translated: The wind is the nature of all.

original: sa la sogs pa'i khams gsum po thams cad la khyad par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di'i bdag nyid do zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i khams gsum po thams cad la khyad par byed pa nyid kyi phyir 'di'i bdag nyid do zhes byas nas so //
translated: Because it is the nature of all, it is the nature of the three elements of earth and so on, because it is the one that distinguishes them.

original: yang dag gnas ni sangs rgyas kun bdag bde ba mchog / ces 'brel lo //
analyzed: yang dag gnas ni sangs rgyas kun bdag bde ba mchog / ces 'brel lo //
translated: The true abode is the self of all buddhas, supreme bliss.

original: rtag tu zhes pa 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis mur thug pa med pa'i dus su gnas pa 'di rab tu gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa 'gyur ba med pa nyid kyis mur thug pa med pa'i dus su gnas pa 'di rab tu gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is stated by the word always, which is to say, by the fact that it is unchanging, it abides at all times without end.

original: gsang chen mchog tu dgyes pa na //
analyzed: gsang chen mchog tu dgyes pa na //
translated: In the supreme secret, he is delighted.

original: kun bdag nyid na rtag tu bzhugs //
analyzed: kun bdag nyid na rtag tu bzhugs //
translated: He always abides as the nature of all.

original: zhes pa 'dis gsungs par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis gsungs par ro //
translated: This is stated by the word always.🔽The nature of all buddhas, Vairochana and so forth, is the supreme bliss that pervades.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas rnams kun gyi bdag nyid sham bde bas mchog tu byed khyab par byed do zhes pa sangs rgyas kun bdag khu ba'i ngo bos la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa sangs rgyas rnams kun gyi bdag nyid sham bde bas mchog tu byed khyab par byed do zhes pa sangs rgyas kun bdag khu ba'i ngo bos la sogs pa rnams kyis nye bar mtshon pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa nyid
translated: The nature of the bodhichitta, indicated by the words and so forth, is the same taste as emptiness.

original: kyis nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams dga' ba thams cad kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: kyis nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa'i phyir nam mkha'i khams dga' ba thams cad kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: Because it is like space, the space element is the nature of all joys.

original: de skad du yang phyag rgya chen po thig ler gsungs pa /
analyzed: de skad du yang phyag rgya chen po thig ler gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said in the Mahamudra-tilaka:

original: gsang ba zhes pa 'dir dga' ba //
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa 'dir dga' ba //
translated: Here, the secret is joy.

original: mchog ces pa ni mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ni mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: The supreme is supreme joy.

original: dgyes pa zhes pa khyad dga'i dga' //
analyzed: dgyes pa zhes pa khyad dga'i dga' //
translated: The delighted is the joy of special joy.

original: lhan skyes kun bdag na bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lhan skyes kun bdag na bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The innate is the self of all.

original: zhes so // me long lta bur /
analyzed: zhes so // me long lta bur /
translated: The mirror-like is

original: gang gi ngo bo kun mthong ba yin pa de ni de skad do //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo kun mthong ba yin pa de ni de skad do //
translated: that which sees the nature of all.

original: gsang ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The secret is the pure realm of phenomena,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gzhan gyi spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of anyone other than the Tathagata.

original: de la yod cing de la dmigs pas skye ba'i phyir gsang chen ni me long ye shes so //
analyzed: de la yod cing de la dmigs pas skye ba'i phyir gsang chen ni me long ye shes so //
translated: The great secret is the mirror-like pristine wisdom, because it exists in that and arises by focusing on that.

original: mnyam pa nyid la ni mnyam pa nyid @226b kyi ye shes la'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid la ni mnyam pa nyid @226b kyi ye shes la'o //
translated: The equality is in the pristine wisdom of equality.

original: mchog ste chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: mchog ste chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du mnyam pa nyid rtogs pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The supreme is the pristine wisdom of equality, because it realizes the equality of all phenomena in the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: dgyes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: dgyes pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The delight is the individually discerning pristine wisdom,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid na yang sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa la spro ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid na yang sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa so sor rtog pa la spro ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is the delight in individually discerning the activities of the minds of sentient beings, even while being non-conceptual.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ni bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ni bya ba bsgrub pa'i ye shes te /
translated: All-pervading is the gnosis of accomplishing activities.

original: sems can rnams thams cad la 'di'i bdag nyid bya ba byed pa'i don du nye bar gnas so zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams thams cad la 'di'i bdag nyid bya ba byed pa'i don du nye bar gnas so zhes byas nas so //
translated: It is present in all sentient beings for the purpose of accomplishing their activities.

original: rtag tu ni bzhugs pa shin tu rnam dag gi chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: rtag tu ni bzhugs pa shin tu rnam dag gi chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes te /
translated: Always is the gnosis of the extremely pure dharmadhatu.

original: mu mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu mtha' med pa'i dus su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It abides in limitless time.

original: de bzhin zhes pa ji ltar rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir me long ye shes la gsang chen du brjod pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa ji ltar rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa'i phyir me long ye shes la gsang chen du brjod pa de ltar ro //
translated: Just as, due to the observation of purity, mirror-like gnosis is called the great secret,

original: gsang chen rnam par snang mdzad de /
analyzed: gsang chen rnam par snang mdzad de /
translated: so too is the great secret Vairochana.

original: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: That is because it is not the domain of the hearers and so forth.

original: gsang ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba ni gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The secret is the pure aggregate of form.

original: de khyad par du byas pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khyad par du byas pa de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes the essence of that by being distinguished by that.

original: de ltar yang na zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang na zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, or else,

original: mchog ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gsungs so //
analyzed: mchog ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes su gsungs so //
translated: supreme is said to be the gnosis of equality.

original: yang na de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rtogs pa'i phyir na mchog ni rin chen 'byung ldan tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: yang na de ltar stong pa nyid kyi rtogs pa'i phyir na mchog ni rin chen 'byung ldan tshor ba'i phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Or else, because of the realization of emptiness in that way, the supreme is Ratnasaṃbhava, the essence of the purified aggregate of feeling.

original: dgyes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgyes pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa 'du shes kyi phung po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
